eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Consumable expendable inputs in agricultural production for both crops and livestock, for example fertilisers, seeds, veterinary drugs, etc.

sot: Dijalo tsa selemo tsa hang ka selemo
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Crops that are planted and harvested during the same production season.

nso: Palomoka ya tema ya puno ya leroro
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Area harvested for dry grain (whole grain, seed, beans or unshelled nuts) for commercial purposes, or to be retained for seed, animal feed or human consumption. It therefore excludes areas planted but not harvested owing to hail damage, fire, grazing, etc., and areas harvested but not used for grain, but for silage, etc.

nso: Tema ye e lemetwego leroro/tema ye e lemetwego dijothoro
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: That part of the total area planted that is planted with the intention of harvesting it for grain rather than for silage, grazing or fodder.
definition: Crop grown for sale rather than for consumption on the farm. Synonym is food crop.
definition: Wheat, coarse grains and rice.

sot: Polasi ya kgwebo; polasi ya ho hweba
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A farm producing agricultural products intended for the market, usually registered for value added tax (VAT) and income tax.
definition: A person who produces agricultural products intended for the market. See subsistence farmer.

sot: Dipalopalo tsa tekanyetso ya kotulo; kakanyo ya kotulo
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Quantitative determination of crop yield after harvest.

sot: Dipalopalo tse lebeletsweng tsa kotulo; ditebello tsa kotulo
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Quantitative approximation of the crop yield prepared and released before harvest.

nso: Dithoto ta temo te di bueletago tweleto
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Livestock for breeding (including fish and poultry), dairy, draught, etc. and vineyards, orchards and other plantations of trees yielding repeat products that are under the direct management of the institutional units.

definition: Irrigation practice which minimises the use of water and fertiliser by allowing water to drop slowly to the roots of plants, either onto the soil surface, or directly to the root zone, through a network of valves, pipes, tubing and emitters.
Person trained in agriculture and employed by the Department of category: Agriculture or any other body responsible for rendering assistance to farmers to promote good farming practices.
definition: An area of land, together with its buildings, concerned with the growing of crops or the raising of animals.

definition: One or more farms, smallholdings or pieces of land, whether adjacent or not, operated as a single unit and situated within the same magisterial district or province, on which cultivation is carried out for both commercial and non-commercial purposes, in the open air or under cover. It includes land rented from others, the farmstead and other buildings, cropland, pasture, veld, wasteland and dams, but excludes land leased to others. A farming unit could be owned by a single person, partnership, company, or close corporation, etc.

xho: unkcenkceshelo ngokuvulela amanzi azihambele / unkcenkceshelo ngokuvulela isikhukhula samanzi
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Irrigation practice that spreads water from open field ditches and other conveyance systems.
definition: See cash crop.
definition: Harvested produce of cereals, pulses, oil crops and legumes.

sot: Dijothollo tse kotutsweng; tlhahiso ya dijothollo
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Grain actually removed from the field.
definition: Metric unit of land measurement equivalent to 10 000 square metres.

definition: A substance / mixture of substances used to kill plants that are not wanted in a specific area.
Synonym: weedkiller

xho: izityalo ezingaveliselwa kutya, izityalo zemizi mveliso, izityalo ezithi zisetyenzwe phambi kokuba zibenokusetyenziswa
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info:
definition: Any crop that provides material for industrial processes and products.
Examples: cotton, flax, linen, etc.; tobacco; oilseeds such as sunflower, and beverages such as tea and coffee.
definition: A crop planted between rows of another crop.
definition: Artificial application of water to land to assist in the growing of crops and pastures.
definition: All animals or birds kept or reared mainly for agricultural purposes including cattle, sheep, goats, pigs, horses, poultry, rabbits, etc.
definition: Forest tree that grows in its natural habitat.

sot: Patlisiso e lekantsweng ya tlhahiso; dipatlisiso tse akaretsang tsa tlhahiso
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A survey based on actual counts and measurements made in the field.

sot: Sejalo se hlahisang oli; dijalo tsa oli
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Annual plant whose seeds or fruit are used mainly for extraction of culinary and industrial oils.
definition: Dry seeds harvested from annual oil-bearing crops used for food, feed, seed or industrial purposes.
definition: Crops that are not replanted after each harvest.
definition: A substance / mixture of substances used to kill pests.

nso: Dithokgwa ta go bjalwa/mehlare ya pholantheiene
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Trees that are planted by the holder on the holding, e.g. eucalyptus trees. See natural forest tree.

sot: Dijalo tsa peo ya dikgaketla; monawa
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: An annual leguminous plant yielding seeds used for food, feed, seed, and industrial purposes.
definition: A system of agriculture or agricultural production in which a landowner allows a tenant to use the land in return for a share of the crop produced on the land.

sot: Patlisiso ya tlhahiso ka ditsebi; dipatlisiso tsa tlhahiso ka botsebi
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A survey based on information obtained from farmers about their fields based on opinion or experience.
definition: A person who produces crops primarily for own consumption.
definition: See drip irrigation.
definition: See herbicide.
definition: Amount of product harvested per unit area.

xho: Imveliso yommandla ovuniweyo/ isivuno saloo ndawo
nso: Puno go twa temeng ye e bunnwego
sot: Hlahiso ya serapa se kotutsweng; tjhai ya tshimo ka nngwe e kotutsweng
tsn: Thobo ka kgaolo e e kotutsweng
tso: Ntshovelo ku ya hi ndhawu leyi tshoveriweke
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Yield from the area actually harvested.

xho: Imveliso yommandla otyaliweyo/ isivuno sendawo etyaliweyo
nso: Puno go twa temeng ye e lemilwego
sot: Tlhahiso ya serapa se lenngweng; tjhai ya tshimo ka nngwe e jetsweng
tsn: Thobo ka kgaolo e e jwetsweng
tso: Ntshovelo ku ya hi ndhawu leyi rimiweke
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Yield from the area planted.

xho: ikhomishini, ucuntsu wemali enikezwa abo bancedisa umnini weshishini athengise iimpahla zakhe
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: An amount of money, usually linked to the quantity of the goods or services sold, paid to sales persons.

nso: Sehlongwa sa kgwebo / Setheo sa kgwebo
eng_pos_or_descriptor: System of Registers / category: Business Enterprises
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: An enterprise, or part of an enterprise, which is situated at a single location in which only a single productive activity is carried out or in which the principal productive activity accounts for most of the value added.
definition: Tax levied on the financial income of a person, cooperation or other legal entity.
definition: An area that predominantly has industry as its main land use.

zul: Imali elahleke ngqo / Imali ecwile ngqo
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Excess of expenditure over sales revenue.
definition: Excess of sales revenue over the cost of production.

definition: A place of business for retailing goods / services.
Examples: shop, market, service establishment, or other place, where goods and / or services are sold.

nso: Ntlo ye e dikaneditwego le te dingwe
ssw: Indlu lesekhatsi kwesidlidli setindlu / Likhaya emkhatsini wemakhaya labiyelwe lutsango lunye / Inculumba
ven: Nnu ya tshigwadani / Nnu ire dzharaani nthihi na dziwe
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A freestanding property / house in a complex with a common boundary wall, but not sharing dwelling walls.

nbl: Indawo yokuditjha ngendlini / Lindawo zomuntu woke ngekhaya
xho: amagumbi asetyenziswa ngumntu wonke ohlala kuloo mzi
ven: Lufhera lwa muanganelwa / Lufhera lu shumiswaho nga mia minzhi
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Rooms that are used by several members of the household for common purposes or activities, e.g. eating, watching television or movies, sitting, etc.

ven: Yuniti ya / Tshipia tsha / Fhethu ha vhuanganedzatshumelo
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: An entity to which the service is / would be delivered, and which receives one bill if the service is billed; alternatively known as a delivery point.
definition: A dwelling that has been destroyed.

nso: Moraka / Bodulo bjoo bo sa agiwago / Letlema
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A dwelling unit that has not been built completely.

nso: Ngwako wa bjang / Ntlo ya bjang
ven: Nnu yo fhaiwaho nga mavu ya hanga ya hatsi / ya mahayani /
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info:
definition: A hut is one form of dwelling found mainly in non-urban (rural) areas, thus a round structure made of materials such as mud walls and thatch or grass roofs.
Note: A hut may not necessarily be round; it may have any other shape.

definition: All structures other than buildings.
Inclusions: Highways, streets, roads, bridges, etc.

nso: Ntlo ye e kgomaganego le ye nngwe
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: One of two houses joined together with one common wall. Each house usually has its own private ground and has no other dwelling below or above it.

ven: Vhudzulo ha tshipentshela / Vhudzulo ha ndivho nthihi
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Dwellings or structures not privately occupied by a household but rather by individuals with one or more common characteristics. Note: Occupants are usually provided with communal meals served from a common kitchen. Other facilities such as bathrooms and laundries are also shared. These dwellings include institutions such as hospitals, prisons, homes for special-care citizens (e.g. aged, disabled, juvenile offenders, etc.), boarding schools and some workers' hostels

ven: U fhaa nga basha na u nama
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A traditional construction method whereby walls are built with wooden sticks / poles and covered with mud or a mixture of mud and clay.

nso: Antherophometheriki / Kelo ya maemo a phepo
sot: Tekolo ya phepo ho ya ka seemo
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Use of body measurements, such as height and weight, to determine a persons nutritional status.
definition: A survey conducted on the full set of observation objects belonging to a given population or universe.

xho: amalungu ekhaya nachithe ubuncinci beentsuku ezine ngeveki belala kwelo khaya
sot: Setho sa ntlong / Setho sa madulammoho
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A person that resides with the household for at least four nights a week. Note : Exclusions : Domestic workers, unless they are paid in kind. Children at boarding school
definition: Two or more households living in the same dwelling unit.

ven: Mualuwa a re na vhuifhinduleli / Muthu muhulwane a re na vhuifhinduleli
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: If the household head is not available for an interview it is possible to speak to another responsible adult in the household.
definition: The opening of the way, through legislation and a conductive environment, for everybody to gain access to opportunities that lead to some perceived benefits.

eng: Adult Basic category: Education and Training
afr: Basiese Onderwys en Opleiding vir Volwassenes
nso: Thuto ya Motheo le Tlhahlo ya Batho ba Bagolo
sot: Thuto ya Motheo le Kwetliso ya Batho ba Baholo
ven: Pfunzo ya mutheo na vhugudisi ha vhaaluwa
tso: Dyondzo ya Masungulo na Ndzetelo wa Lavakulu
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: All learning and training programmes for adults from levels 1 to 4, where ABET level 4 is equivalent to grade 9 in public schools, or a National Qualifications Framework level 1, as stipulated in the South African Qualifications Authority Act (Act 58 of 1995).

nso: Reio ya boingwadio ya mengwaga ye e itego
sot: Reshiyo ya ba ingodiseditseng ho ithuta ho ya ka dilemo
ssw: Silinganiso selinani lekubhalisa kwebafundzi ngekweminyaka yebudzala
ven: Phimo ya u walisa ho sedzwa vhukale ho tewaho
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Percentage of the population of a specific age enrolled, irrespective of the level of education.

definition: Enrolled at and going regularly to any accredited educational institution (public or private) for organised learning at any level of education. Attendance can be full-time or part-time, and distance learning is included. Temporary absence, e.g. due to illness, does not interrupt attendance.
definition: Nine years of schooling from grade 1 to grade 9.

sot: Thuto ya tlameho; thuto e tlamang
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The number of years or the age-span during which children and youth are legally obliged to attend school.

sot: Karolo ya baingodisi bohle; palo ya boingodiso bohle
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Percentage of the total enrolment at all levels to the total population.

definition: Study by means of correspondence, telecommunication media or computer programmes. Courses are self-instructional and two-way communication takes place between student and the institution. Learners need not be on campus to attend classes but can continue their normal work programmes at home.

nso: Reiti ya go tlogela sekolo/ Kelo ya balesasekolo
ven: Phimo ya u litsha tshikolo/ vhamoi
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Learners who leave the education system without completing a given grade. The drop-out rate is calculated as a residual figure which is derived after the repetition and promotion rates are calculated. The drop-out rate in a particular grade for a particular year is calculated by simply deducting the repetition and promotion rate for that particular grade and year from 100%.

sot: Setsi / Setheo sa thuto / Institjushene ya thuto
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Any institution providing education. Inclusions: early childhood education, primary, secondary, further or higher education, institution providing specialised, vocational, adult, distance or community education.
definition: Deprecated. Use highest level of education or educational attainment.
definition: See highest level of education.

nso: Lefelo la thuto/ insitituene ya thuto
sot: Setsha se ngodisitsweng sa thuto; institjhushene ya thuto
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Any registered institution whose sole or main purpose is the provision of education, including preschool, tertiary, adult education, etc.
definition: Any person who teaches, educates or trains other persons or who provides professional educational services.
definition: A learner who is registered at a school.
definition: The act of officially being admitted to a programme of study.

sot: Karolo ya baingodisi; palo ya boingodiso
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Proportion of the population in a specified age group attending school to the total population in that age group.

sot: Lekala le ikgethileng la thuto; lekala la thuto
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The area of concentration of tertiary studies.

sot: Thuto ya mananeo a hlophisitsweng; thuto e hlophisitsweng
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The education attained at an educational institution that follow a given approved curriculum.
definition: A stage of instruction usually covered in one school year.

xho: Umlinganiselo wobhaliso lwebanga elithile /ireshiyo yobhaliso lwebanga elithile
nso: Tekanyokelo ya boingwadio kereiting ye e itego
sot: Karolo ya barutwana ho ya ka kereiti; palo ya boingodiso kereiting
ven: Ndivhanele ya kuwaliselendivhiswa kha murole / gireidi
tso: Mpimoxiave wa ntsariso wa giredi yo karhi
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Ratio of the enrolment in a specific class to the total enrolment at all levels.
definition: A student who has successfully completed all requirements of an educational programme and has been awarded a certificate of completion.

sot: Karolo ya barutwana ho ya ka dilemo; palo ya boingodiso bohle
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The total enrolment of pupils in a grade or cycle or level of education, regardless of age, expressed as percentage of the corresponding eligible official age-group population in a given school year.

definition: All learning programmes leading to qualifications higher than grade 12 or its equivalent in terms of the National Qualifications Framework as contemplated in the South African Qualifications Authority Act, 1995 (Act No. 58 of 1995), including tertiary education as contemplated in schedule 4 of the Constitution.

nso: Setheo / Sehlongwa sa thuto ya godimo
sot: Setheo sa thuto e phahemeng / Institjushene ya thuto e phahemeng
tso: Ndhawu ya dyondzo ya le henhla
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: Any institution that provides higher education on a full-time or part-time basis, and which is established or deemed to be established as a public higher education institution under the Higher category: Education Act, 1997; and declared as a public higher education institution under the Higher category: Education Act, 1997.

tso: Mfikelelo wa le henhla wa tidyondzo
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The highest grade completed at school or the highest post-school qualification obtained. Synonym is educational attainment.

definition: A programme of education that a parent of a learner(s) may provide to his / her child at their own home. In addition a parent may, if necessary, enlist the specific services of a tutor for specific areas of the curriculum; or a legal independent form of education, alternative to attendance at a public or an independent school.

nso: Go ithuta mo e sego ga semmuo / Go ithuta go go sa elwego sekolong
sot: Thuto ntle le ho kena sekolo
ven: U guda hu si ha fomaa/tshiofisi
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Learning that has been acquired outside a formal course of study taken at a post-secondary institution. Also expressed as non-formal or experiential learning.

sot: Sekgahla sa ba qalang sekolo; palo ya ba qalang sekolong
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The proportion of children, out of all children of admission age, who are coming to school for the first time.

nso: Kelo ya ba go thoma morago
sot: Sekgahla sa ba qalang ka morao ho nako; palo ya ba qalang ba le baholo
tso: Mpimo wa lava hundzeriweke hi nkarhi wo sungula xikolo
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The proportion of all admissions to Grade 1 that are over the official admission age (over 7 years).
definition: Any person receiving education or obliged to receive education in terms of the South African Schools Act, 1996 (Act No. 84 of 1996).

sot: Karolelano ya barutwana ho ya ka matitjhere; palo ya baithuti ba matitjhere
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Total number of students enrolled in a given school divided by the total number of educators in the same school.

definition: The domains through which learners in the GET and FET bands experience a balanced curriculum. They serve as a sound basis for developing the learning programme to be implemented in schools. Eight learning areas were identified for GET and FET bands. Deprecated term is subject.

nso: Tsebo ya go bala le go ngwala
sot: Tsebo ya ho bala le ho ngola
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Ability to read and write with understanding in any language. A person is literate who can, with understanding, both read and write a short simple statement on his everyday life.

nso: Kelo ya tsebo ya go bala le go ngwala
sot: Sekgahla sa tsebo ya ho bala le ho ngola;palo ya ba tsebang ho ngola le ho bala
tso: Mpimo wa vuswikoti byo hlaya no tsala/mpimo wa literesi
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The proportion of the population above 15 years of age who can write and read with understanding, usually expressed as a percentage of the total population above that age.

nso: Tekanyokelo ya tsebo ya go bala le go ngwala
sot: Palo ya ba tsebang ho bala le ho ngola
tso: Mpimoxiave wa vuswikoti byo hlaya no tsala/mpimo xiave wa literesi
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The proportion of the population above 15 years of age who can write and read with understanding, expressed as a percentage of the total population of the same age.

nso: Thuto ye e sego ya semmuo / Thuto ye e sa elwego ka sekolong
sot: Thuto ntle le ho kena sekolo
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Non-formal education may take place both within and outside educational institutions, and may cater to persons of all ages. Depending on country contexts, it may cover educational programmes to impact adult literacy, basic education for out-of-school children, life-skills, work-skills, and general culture. Non-formal education programmes do not necessarily follow the ladder system, may have varying duration, and may or may not confer certification of the learning achieved.

ven: Mutshudeni a sa funzwi tshifhinga tshohe / Mutshudeni a sa dzheni tshikolo tshifhinga tshohe
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A student who does not receive full-time tuition.
definition: Percentage of learners promoted to the next grade in the following school year.

sot: Karolelano ya barutwana ho ya ka matitjhere; palo ya baithuti ka titjhere
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Total number of students enrolled in a given school divided by the total number of educators in the same school. Synonym is learner-educator ratio.

definition: Successful completion of a level of education or organized course of study, usually denoted by the acquisition of a certificate, e.g. school-leaving certificate, diploma, degree or professional title.
definition: A student who enrols in the same grade or year of study of the same educational programme for a second or further time.

sot: Sekgahla sa ba phetang; palo ya ba phetang
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The percentage of learners who are enrolled in the same grade in the current school year as in the previous school year.
definition: A person attending primary or secondary school.

definition: An educational institution or that part of such an institution at which education and training, including pre-primary education, is provided and which is maintained, managed and controlled or subsidised by a provincial education department, excluding a university and technikon.
definition: A person attending a college, university or some other post-school educational institution, whether part-time or full-time.

zul: Izinga lokuqhubekela phambili/izinga labafike ebangeni elithile
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The percentage of a learner cohort that enters together in the first grade of primary education and that reaches a given grade (e.g. Grade 5) or the final grade of an education cycle, either with or without repeating a grade. See drop-out rate.
definition: Tokens to the equivalent of the free basic electricity that households are entitled to and for use in pre-paid electricity systems.
definition: The general purpose Alternating Current (AC) electrical power supply.

xho: indawo ethenga izinto ezindala ezinokuphinda zisebenziseke
ssw: Indzawo letsenga tintfo letingakhandvwa kabusha / letingentiwa busha / Engwendeni
ven: Senthara ya u renga zwithu zwo shumiswaho
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A place where people or households bring recyclable products with the intention of selling them.
definition: Measures that are planned, implemented and controlled to avoid / alleviate the impact of human-originated pollution and natural disasters on biodiversity.

nso: Diphaka ta mmuo le mafelo a boitapoloo
ven: Phakha dza muvhuso na fhethu ha vhuimvumvusi
tso: Phaka ya tiko na ndhawu ya vuhungaselo
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: This includes golf courses, caravan parks, nature reserves, forest areas, state land, public entertainment areas, parks and botanical gardens.

sot: Botsamaisi ba dilahlwa / Ho hlekwa ha matlakala
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The collection, treatment and disposal of waste.
definition: Sewerage system operations and waste water treatment.

definition: Person recognized or nominated by the household as assuming the role of the household head in the absence of the usual household head.
Note: this may be because the person recognized as the household head stays elsewhere for work purposes, or because he/she was not present on the reference night (census) or for the required period of time in the reference period (surveys).

definition: The interval of time between the day, month and year of birth and the day and year of occurrence of the event expressed in the largest completed unit of solar time such as years for adults and children, and months, weeks, days, hours or minutes of life, as appropriate, for infants under one year of age.

definition: Age expressed as the number of years lived by an individual; the persons age at their last birthday. Age is also derived from the date of birth question and is the age at a persons last birthday.
definition: A person who receives accommodation and meals in someone elses house in return for payment.
definition: All those diseases, morbid conditions or injuries which either resulted in or contributed to death and the circumstances of the accident or violence which produced any such injuries.
definition: A person under the age of 18 years.
definition: Ones son or daughter.

nso: Bana ba ba belegilwego/bana ba thari
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info:
definition: All children born to a woman, whether in or out of marriage, whether born in a present or a previous marriage or union, and whether living or dead at the time of the census.
Stillbirths (children born dead) are not included.
definition: A branch of religion or faith group. For example, where religion is given as Christian, the denomination might be given as Methodist.

definition: A physical or mental handicap which has lasted for six months or more, or is expected to last at least six months, which prevents the person from carrying out daily activities independently, or from participating fully in educational, economic or social activities. See handicap and impairment.
definition: Marital status where a persons marriage has been legally dissolved and he/she has not remarried.
definition: Social distinction between males and females. See sex.

definition: The process of identifying and classifying the roles of women and men in a given community, their relations, access to and control over resources and benefits. It also includes a systematic examination of the different impacts (potential and/or actual) of a development programme on women and men.

definition: Constraints on the relationship between the person with a disability and the social and physical environment, for example, in the areas of education, occupation, information or communication. See impairment.
definition: A baby who has not attained his/her first birthday.

eng: Language spoken most often in the household
afr: Taal wat die meeste in die huishouding gepraat word
tsn: Puo e e buiwang thata mo gae
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The language most often used by the individual at home, whether or not they consider it their mother tongue.
definition: The last child born alive, whether still living or not.

eng: Living together as a married couple
afr: Woon saam soos n getroude paar
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Two persons who live together in the same household as a married couple but who are not married to each other; a cohabiting couple.

definition: Personal status of each individual in relation to the marriage laws or customs of a country. Customary unions are now recognised as a legal marital status. Categories under marital status include single, married, living together as a married couple, divorced, separated and widowed.

definition: The act, ceremony or process by which the legal relationship of husband and wife is constituted. Marriages are categorised in South Africa as civil, religious, or traditional/customary. A marriage that was solemnised as civil as well as in either of the other ways is categorised as civil.
definition: Having a husband or wife. See marital status.
definition: One of two people living together as a married couple. Relationship of each to the other in a cohabiting couple.

definition: A group with common characteristics (in terms of descent and history), particularly in relation to how they were (or would have been) classified before the 1994 elections. The following categories are provided in the census: Black African, coloured, Indian or Asian, white, other.
definition: Deprecated. Use population group.
definition: Religious or spiritual belief or preference, or an affiliation with an organised group having specific religious or spiritual tenets.

afr: Van tafel en bed geskei [van tafel en bed geskeide ...]
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Situation where a married couple have parted without divorcing, thus allowing for reuniting if they wish at some time in the future. This is not a legal marital status under South African law, and is therefore self-defined.

definition: Situation where a married couple have entered a court or written agreement describing the terms under which they will live apart while remaining married. Legal separation is a possible step towards divorce, but also allows for the couple to reunite.
definition: Biological distinction between males and females. See gender.

sot: Papiso ya bong; palo ya bong
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The ratio of the number of males to the number of females, usually expressed as a percentage.
definition: Person who is not married or cohabiting. Compare single (legal). See marital status.

sot: Ya eso nyale/ nyalwe ho hang ; ya sa nyalang; ya sa nyalwang
ven: U sa vhuya wa dzhia / dzhiwa /malwa
tso: Ku nga si tshama u tekiwa/teka
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Person who has never been married. Compare single (common usage). See marital status.

definition: Person visiting or staying with a household who is not a usual member of the household, that is, does not stay in the household four nights a week on average. Compare visitor under Tourism and migration.
definition: Woman whose husband has died and who has not married again. See marital status.
definition: Marital status of a person whose spouse has died and who has not married again. See widow and widower.
definition: Man whose wife has died and who has not married again. See marital status.
definition: Young person typically between the ages of 14 and 25 or 35. The exact age range must be specified in any analysis.
definition: A document code for an enumerators summary book.
definition: Hierarchical combination of elements that results in a unique identifier for a structure or land parcel. See primary address, secondary address, postal address.
definition: An area that falls under a recognised jurisdiction, such as a magisterial district or a municipality. It is bounded by a legally defined line.
definition: An area that falls under a recognized jurisdiction, such as magisterial district or a municipality. It is bounded by a legally defined line.
definition: A public register showing details of ownership, tenure and value of individual parcels of land.

sot: Palabatho ka dikarolo tsa naha; thutalefatshe ya palabatho
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info:
definition: The spatial divisions into which the country is demarcated for the purpose of census enumeration, as well as to facilitate data processing and analysis.
Note: It also provides the sampling frame for other surveys.

sot: Ho ralla palo ya batho meedi; moedi, palabatho
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The process of dividing the land into enumeration areas, with clear boundaries and of a defined enumeration area type.
definition: The number of people per given area. See size and density of locality.
definition: An area managed by a district municipality.
definition: See district management area.
definition: A number assigned to a private dwelling during listing.
definition: See enumeration area.
definition: The process of counting all the members of a given population and collecting demographic and other information about each person. See direct interview and self-enumeration.
definition: The smallest geographical unit (piece of land) into which the country is divided for census or survey purposes. See enumeration area type.

sot: Nomoro ya sebaka sa ho bala
ven: Nomboro ya tshipia / vhupo ha mbalavhathu
tso: Nomboro ya ndhawu ya nhlayelo wa vanhu
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A unique number given to an EA for the purpose of record-keeping and coding.

sot: Mofuta wa sebaka sa ho bala
ven: Lushaka lwa tshipia / vhupo ha mbalavhathu
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The classification of enumeration areas according to set criteria profiling land use and human settlement within the area. Note: Not to be confused with geography type, which is a broader classification.
definition: A person who visits households or individuals in a specific enumeration area for the purpose of administration of questionnaires or for self-enumeration.

sot: Buka e kgutsufaditsweng ya mmalabatho; paka ya kgutsafatso ya mmadi
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A register of demarcation and listing information pertaining to a particular EA, known colloquially as the 09 book, which identifies an EA by province, local authority, main place name and subplace name, and by means of maps and/or aerial photographs. Used during enumeration to record key information such as visits or attempted visits, and total households and people counted.
definition: The sites and stand, yard, or plot described by cadastre on a map.
definition: A unique 21-digit number assigned to an individual erf.
definition: Plural of Erf.
definition: Classification of structures as per main use.

sot: Tlhophiso ya tjhabisetso ka lefatshe; tlhophiso ya tsebo ka lefatshe
tso: Sisiteme ya mahungu ya swa ntivomisava
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A system or hardware, software and procedures designed to support the capturing, management , monitoring , manipulation, analysis, modeling and display of spatially referenced data.
definition: An approach whereby tariffs are set on an area with the assumption that consumers living in that area have the same socio-economic profile.
definition: Classification according to settlement characteristics.
definition: See density, population.
definition: All collective living quarters other than hostels  one of ten geographical EA types. See enumeration area type. Compare institution (enumeration) under Housing and services.
definition: A compilation of a register of all dwellings and other structures in a given Enumeration Area.
definition: See, density, population.
definition: Subdivision of the country for the administration of the judicial system as proclaimed by the Department of Justice.
definition: First level of place names.

sot: Mmasepala e moholo; sebaka sa mmasepala e moholo
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Category A municipality.
definition: The area of jurisdiction of the third sphere of government, after national and provincial.
definition: The area of jurisdiction of the third sphere of government, after national and provincial.
definition: Any area not classified as urban. See geography type. See also density, population.
definition: Hierarchical combination of elements that results in a unique identifier for a structure or land parcel. See primary address, secondary address, and postal address.
definition: The civic entities below the level of municipality in the census geography hierarchy. See main place and subplace.
definition: A unique identifier for delivering post to an individual or organisation.
definition: Physical address of a land parcel or structure.
definition: Farms and traditional areas characterised by low population densities, low levels of economic activity and low levels of infrastructure.
definition: Any area that is not classified urban. Rural areas may comprise one or more of the following: tribal areas, commercial farms and informal settlements. See settlement type.
definition: A unique identifier for a sub-unit within a structure or land parcel.

ven: U kanula mikhukhuni/mishashani / Nila ya u vhea mikano mikhukhuni / mishashani
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The listing procedure used in informal settlements to sub-divide the area into smaller parts that are defined by boundaries such as footpaths, dirt / gravel roads etc., and other prominent land marks.
definition: Deprecated. Use geography type.

definition: A classification of geographical areas into high density or large settlement, and low density. Note: This variable provides an alternative basis of analysis to the urban/rural classification.

nso: Mmepe wa go thalwa ka seatla
ven: Mepe wa tshiketshe/wo walwaho nga tshana
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info:
definition: A hand-drawn map of an area.
Note: Sketch maps do not possess the high order of accuracy contained in topographic maps.

nbl: Umtlayo wokutjala / Wokufuya Isikhekhe sokutjala / Sokufuya
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A piece of land smaller than a farm used for cultivation of vegetables or the breeding of animals.
definition: A person attending a college, university or some other post-school educational institution, whether part-time or full-time.
definition: Second (lowest) level of place names. See main place.
definition: Areas within a town or city proclaimed or set aside mainly for residing purposes. See informal settlement and subplace.
definition: An area proclaimed as such by a local authority profiling a specific land use unique to urban functions.
definition: An area proclaimed as such by a local authority profiling a specific land use unique to urban functions.
definition: Communally owned land under the jurisdiction of a traditional leader.
definition: Deprecated. Use traditional area.

nso: Madulo a taolo ya kgoi / Metseselegae
ven: Vhupo ha khosi/kusi / Muvhundu ure fhasi ha khosi
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: An area that is legally proclaimed to be under tribal authorities.
definition: See unit identifier.
definition: A unique number for each structure on a land parcel, e.g. number assigned by the local authority or a service provider.
definition: Formal cities and towns characterised by higher population densities, high levels of economic activities and high levels of infrastructure.

A continuously built-up area with characteristics such as type of economic activity and land use. Cities, towns, townships, suburbs, etc. are typical urban areas. An urban area is one which was proclaimed as such (i.e. in an urban municipality under the old demarcation) or classified as such during census demarcation by the category: Geography department of Stats SA based on their observation of the aerial photographs or on other information. See settlement type and EA type.

eng: Urban settlements {definition: Urban settlements occur on land that has been proclaimed as residential. A formal urban settlement is usually structured and organised. Plots or erven make up a formal and permanent arrangement. A local council or district council controls development in these areas. Services such as water, sewage, electricity and refuse removal are provided; roads are formally planned and maintained by the council. This includes suburbs and townships.}
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Urban settlements (formal) occur on land that has been proclaimed as residential. A formal urban settlement is usually structured and organised. Plots or erven make up a formal and permanent arrangement. A local council or district council controls development in these areas. Services such as water, sewage, electricity and refuse removal are provided; roads are formally planned and maintained by the council. This includes suburbs and townships.

definition: Urban informal settlements, or 'squatter camps', are usually located in urban areas. The dwelling units in informal settlements are usually made of materials such as zinc, mud, wood, plastics, etc. They are typically disorderly and congested and are sometimes referred to as squatter settlements.

xho: umhlaba ongasetyenziswanga/ umhlaba ekungekho mntu kuwo
nso: Naga ye e sa omiwego / Molala
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Land not currently being used.
definition: A settlement located within a traditional area.

definition: A communal living quarter for workers, provided by a public organisation such as a local authority, or a private organisation such as a mining company. These were residential dormitories established for migrant workers during the apartheid era, and they continue to house people working in certain industries, such as the mining industry.

nso: Monono wa nywaga ye itego/maamuo a nywaga ye itego
tsn: Dingwaga tse di totilweng tsa loumo
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The number of live births in a given year per 1 000 women or per woman in each childbearing age group from 15 19 up to 4549.
definition: Weight within the first hour of life before a significant postnatal weight loss has occurred.

sot: Palo ya kakanyo ya boima ba mmele
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A statistical measure of the weight of a person scaled according to height, used to estimate if a person is underweight or overweight.

tso: Nhlayo ya ku fa ka vana
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Deaths per 1 000 children that survive to their first birthday. See infant mortality, child mortality, neonatal mortality, post-neonatal mortality, and under-five mortality.

tso: Leswi nga na xiave eka swivangelo swa rifu
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Morbid conditions, if any, giving rise to the immediate cause of death.

definition: The number of live births observed in a population over a given period relative to the size of the population as estimated at the middle of that time period. The rate is usually stated per 1 000 and the most usual period is one year.

definition: The number of deaths in a year per 1 000 mid-year population of a specific year. It is the ratio of the annual number of deaths occurring to the number exposed to the risk of dying during the reference period.

sot: Tswalo ya ba phelang ha jwale
tsn: Masea a a tshotsweng a tshela gajaana
ven: Mabebo a khanwa / tshetshe / tshie dzi tshilaho a tshifhingatehwa
tso: Ntswalo wa lava hanyaka wa sweswi
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Births occurring in a specific year and registered within the same year.
definition: Is a principal event and is the disappearance of life at any time after birth has taken place.
definition: The childbearing status of women, couples, groups or the population (only live births).
definition: See Human immunodeficiency virus.

nso: Baerase ye e fokotago maole a mmele
sot: Kwatsi ; vaerase e bolayang masole a mmele
eng_pos_or_descriptor: HIV / category: Health and Vital Statistics
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The pathogenic organism responsible for acquired Immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS), formally or also known as lymphadenopathy virus (LAV), the name given by the Montagnier Et al. in 1983, or the human T-cells lymphrotropic virus type III (HTLV-III), the name given by Gallo et al. to the virus reported in 1984.

nso: Lebaka la ka pejana la go hlola lehu
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The disease or condition directly leading to death.

nso: Dikelo ta mahu a masea le bana
sot: Sekgahla sa ho shwa ha masea le bana
ven: Zwikalampfu dza khanwa / tshetshe/ tshie na vhana
tso: Mipimo ya mafu ya ticece na vana
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: See neonatal mortality, post-neonatal mortality, under-five mortality and child mortality. All rates are expressed as deaths per 1 000 live births, except child mortality, which is expressed as deaths per 1 000 children surviving to the first birthday.
definition: Number of deaths of children under one year occurring in the same year.
definition: A type of malnutrition caused by insufficient protein consumption.
definition: Births occurring in a given calendar year but recorded in subsequent calendar years.

nso: Tlholoketapele ye e bataletego/bobamego ya lehu
sot: Sesosa se itlhommeng pele sa lefu
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The most frequent underlying cause of death in any given population.

definition: An estimate of the average number of additional years a person could expect to live if the age-specific death rates for a given year prevailed for the rest of his/her life. This can be derived for either males or females and is, in most populations, slightly higher for females. Life expectancy is normally determined at birth but can be derived at any other age based on the current death rates.

nso: Masea a go belegwa a phela
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The complete expulsion or extraction from its mothers womb of a product of conception irrespective of the duration of the pregnancy, which after such separation, breathes or shows any other evidence of life.

definition: A medical condition caused by an improper or inadequate diet or nutrition.
See kwashiorkor / wasting; marasmus, stunting.

xho: isifo sokungondleki esibangelwa kukusilela kweeproteni emzimbeni
ven: Marasimusi/u shaya pfushi dzi wanalaho kha phurotheini
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A form of severe protein-energy malnutrition characterised by energy deficiency.

nso: Kelo ya mahu a batsweti/kelo ya mahu a babelegi
sot: Sekgahla sa ho shwa ha bomme ka lebaka la pelehi
tso: Mpimo wa ku fa ka vayimani
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Number of female deaths that occurred during pregnancy, childbirth, or within 42 days of termination of pregnancy because of any cause related to or aggravated by the pregnancy or its management but not from accidental or incidental causes.

nso: Tekanyokelo ya mahu a batsweti/tekanyokelo ya mahu a babelegi
sot: Karolo ya mafu a pelehi ho bomme; palo ya bomme ba shwang ka lebaka la pelehi
ven: Ndivhanele ya mpfu dza zwikole / vhaimana
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The number of women who die as a result of complications of pregnancy or childbearing in a given year per 100 000 live births in that year.

nso: Mabaka a manti a go hlola mahu
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: All morbid conditions, diseases and injuries entered on the death certificate. Note: These include those involved in the morbid train of events leading to the death which were classified as either the underlying cause, the intermediate cause, or any intervening cause and those conditions which contributed to death but were not related to the disease or condition causing death.

nso: Mahu a masea pele a feta kgwedi
sot: Mafu a masea a ka tlase ho kgwedi; mafu a masea a mafubedu
tsn: Dintsho tsa masea a a ka fa tlase ga kgwedi
ven: Mpfu dza khanwa / tshetshe / tshie nu
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Number of deaths occurring to children under 28 days.

nso: Mahu a masea a ka godimo ga kgwedi
sot: Mafu a masea a ka hodimo ho kgwedi
tsn: Dintsho tsa masea a a fetileng kgwedi
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Number of deaths occurring between 28 days and less than one year.

xho: Ukufa okungqamene nokukhulelwa/ nokumitha/ nokuba nzima
nso: Mahu a go amana le boimana
sot: Mafu a bakwang ke boimana; ho shwa ho amanang le boimana
tsn: Loso lo lo amanang le boimana
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The death of a woman while pregnant or within 42 days of termination of pregnancy, irrespective of the cause of death.

nso: Matswalo a a ngwadiitwego a baphedi/masea
sot: Ngodiso ya ba tswetsweng ba phela
tsn: Pelego e e kwadisitsweng ya masea
ssw: Lababhalisiwe labatelwe baphila / lubhaliso lwalabatelwe baphila
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The number of births recorded (registered) in a specific year, irrespective of when the birth actually occurred. The births recorded in any given year include the births that occurred during that year plus other births that occurred in years prior to the year of registration. It should be noted that not all births are recorded (registered).

sot: Ba hlahileng ba kgathetse; ya tswetsweng a shwele
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Intra-uterine death of a foetus of at least 26 weeks of gestation that showed no sign of life after complete birth.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: marasmus / category: Health and Vital Statistics
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A condition where a childs height is too low for his / her age.
definition: The proportion of persons in a specified group (age, sex, or health status) alive at the beginning of an interval (such as a 5-year period) who survive to the end of the interval.
definition: An indicator that measures the number of children with or without parents. However, for policy purposes, children without parents are normally considered.

definition: Average number of children born alive to a woman during her lifetime if she were to bear children at each age in accordance with the prevailing age-specific fertility rates. It is obtained by summing up all age-specific fertility rates for each year of the childbearing span.

nso: Mahu a bana ba ka tlase ga mengwaga ye mehlano
sot: Ho shwa ha ba ka tlase ho dilemo tse hlano
tsn: Dintsho tsa ba ba ka fa tlase ga dingwaga tse tlhano
ven: Mpfu dza vha fhasi ha miwaha mianu
tso: Ku fa ehansi ka ntlhanu wa malembe
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The probability of dying between birth and the fifth birthday.

nso: Lebaka le le bobamego la go hlola lehu
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The disease or injury that initiated the train of events leading to death; or the circumstances of the accident or violence that produced the fatal injury.
definition: A condition where a childs weight is too low for his / her height.

definition: Expenditure on goods and services acquired, and privately used by household members, including imputed values for items produced and consumed by the household itself. See non-consumption expenditure. See also durable, semi-durable and non-durable goods.

nso: Dithoto ta go kgotlelela/diphahlo ta go kgotlelela/tea lebaka le le telele
ven: Thundu dza ndalamo/thundu dza ndeme khulwane
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Household items that last for a long time, such as kitchen appliances, computers, radios and televisions, cars and furniture, usually acquired once in several years. Compare semi-durable goods and non-durable goods.
definition: Assets belonging to a household.
definition: An economic activity carried out by members of a household at the same physical address, e.g. backyard chicken-rearing, handcrafts, etc.
definition: Amount spent by the household in the reference peried in cash, kind or through barter, consisting of consumption and non-concumption expenditure.

definition: All receipts by all members of a household, in cash and in kind, in exchange for employment, or in return for capital investment, or receipts obtained from other sources such as pension, etc. Compare household income (census).

tsn: Ditshenyegelo tse e seng tsa dijego
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Expenditure on items such as taxes, and remittances and contributions to members of other households.

nso: Dithoto ta go se kgotlelele/dithoto ta go se tee lebaka le le telele
tsn: Dithoto tse di sa tshwareleleng; majaja
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Household items that do not last long, for example food, and personal care items. Households acquire these items on a daily, weekly or monthly basis. See durable goods and semi-durable goods.

sot: Thepa e tswarellang nako e teletsana
ven: Thundu dza ndalamozwayo/ thundu dza ndeme zwayo
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Household items that last longer than non-durable goods but still need replacing more often than durable goods. Example: clothing, shoes, material for clothing.
definition: A structure, usually multi-storey, consisting of a number of dwellings sharing the same residential address, and usually sharing a common entrance, foyer or staircase. See flat.
definition: Built structure with a roof and walls.

definition: Premises originally intended for the temporary accommodation of persons with common activities or interests, e.g. military camps, refugee camps and camps established for the housing of workers in mining, agriculture, public works or other types of enterprises.

eng: Collective living quarters / communal living quarters
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info:
definition: 1. Structurally separate and independent places of abode intended for habitation by large groups of individuals or several households. Such quarters usually have certain common facilities, such as cooking and ablution facilities, lounges or dormitories, which are shared by the occupants. Collective living quarters may be further classified into hotels, rooming houses and other lodging houses, institutions and camps.
2. Living quarters where certain facilities are shared by groups of individuals or households. They can be divided into: (a) hotels, motels, guest houses, etc.; (b) workers hostels and student residences; and (c) institutions.
definition: Hostel where the accommodation has been converted into self-contained units for households. See workers hostel.

nso: Kotase ya moomi wa ka lapeng
tsn: Bonno ba modiri/mothusi wa mo gae; dikotase tsa modiri/mothusi wa mo gae
tso: Vutshamo bya mutirhi wa le kaya
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Physical structure on the same erf/plot as main property intended as living quarters for a domestic worker.
definition: See dwelling unit.
definition: Any structure intended or used for human habitation. Synonym is living quarters.

nso: Bodulo bja go se be bja semolao
tso: Vutshamo, byo ka byi nga ri bya ximfumo
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: See informal dwelling.
definition: A dwelling made primarily of clay, mud, reeds or other locally available natural materials. Such dwellings can be found as single units or in clusters.

definition: Structure or part of a structure or group of structures occupied or meant to be occupied by one or more than one household. Includes structure or part of a structure which is vacant and/or under construction, but can be lived in at the time of the survey. Includes units in collective living quarters, unlike a housing unit. Dwelling units may therefore comprise housing units plus units in collective living quarters when applicable.

nso: Bodulo bja go se be le motho
tsn: Bonno, bo bo se nang ope
ven: Vhudzulo vhu si na muthu / ndi mahagala
tso: Vutshamo, vinyi va nga ri kona
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A dwelling whose inhabitants are absent at the time of the visit or during the reference period during a census or survey.

nso: Bodulo bja go se dulwe ke motho
tso: Vutshamo, byo ka byi nga tshamiwi hi munhu
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A dwelling that is uninhabited, i.e. no one lives there.

eng: Electricity for cooking, heating and/or lighting
afr: Elektrisiteit vir kook-, verhittings- en/of verligtingsdoeleindes
xho: Umbane wokupheka, ukufudumeza kunye okanye ukukhanyisa
nso: Mohlagase wa go apea, go rutheta le/ goba go bonega
sot: Motlakase o phehang, futhumatsang le/kapa o kgantshang
tsn: Motlakase wa go apaya, go thuthafatsa le/kgotsa go bonesa/bonega
tso: Gezi ro sweka, ro hisisa na/ kumbe ku lumeka
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Electricity from the public supplier.
ven_pos_or_descriptor: wa u bika, u dudedza, u funga

eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: An undertaking concerned with the generation or transmission and distribution of electricity, including electrical power installations, which as subsidiary divisions of undertakings produce electricity for regular use by these undertakings.
definition: A dwelling, usually on one floor, with at least one wall shared with another such dwelling, within a block of flats. Synonym is apartment. See also block of flats.

definition: A structure built according to approved plans, i.e house on separate stands, flat or apartment, townhouse, room in a backyard, rooms or flatlets elsewhere contrasted with informal dwelling and traditional dwelling.

zul: Isabelo sikagesi samahhala; ugesi ophakelwa mahhala
ven: Muagasiphiwa tshayambadelo/muagasi wa mutheo wa mahala
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: An amount of electricity determined by government that should be provided free to poor households to meet basic needs, currently set at 50 kWh per month per household.

zul: Isabelo samanzi samahhala; amanzi aphakelwa mahhala
ven: Maiphiwa tshayambadelo/mai a mutheo a mahala
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: An amount of water determined by government that should be provided free to poor households to meet basic needs, currently set at 6 kl per month per household within 200 metres from each dwelling.
definition: A collective form of accommodation for workers or students, but not including boarding school hostels. See workers hostel.
definition: An establishment providing accommodation and meals for pay. See collective living quarters, tourist hotel and residential hotel.
definition: A freestanding dwelling.

definition: A unit of accommodation for a household, which may consist of one structure, or more than one structure, or part of a structure. (Examples of each are a house, a group of rondavels, and a flat.) It may be vacant, or occupied by one or more than one household. A housing unit usually has a separate entrance from outside or from a common space, as in a block of flats. See dwelling unit, living quarters and collective living quarters.

nso: Setlabakelo sa go hlweka sa botshwelamare/ thoilete
sot: Maranrang a tlhwekiso ya ntlwana; matlwana a hlwekileng
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Flush toilet, chemical toilet or pit latrine with ventilation pipe.

eng: Index of physical volume of electricity production
afr: Indeks van fisiese volume van elektrisiteitsproduksie
nso: Kelothupeto ya boleng bjo bo bonalago bja tweleto ya mohlagase
sot: Tshupane ya bongata ba tlhahiso ya motlakase
tso: Xikombo xa vholumumbonakalo ya andziso wa gezi
eng_pos_or_descriptor: Social Statistics / category: Housing and Services
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A statistical measure of the change in the volume of production of electricity in a given period and the volume of production of electricity in the base period.

nso: Ntlo ya go se be ya semolao
tso: Vutshamo byo ka byi nga ri bya ximfumo
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A makeshift structure not erected according to approved architectural plans, for example shacks or shanties in informal settlements or in backyards.

nso: Madulo a go se be a semolao
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: An unplanned settlement on land that has not been surveyed or proclaimed as residential, consisting mainly of informal dwellings (shacks).
definition: Communal place of residence for people with a common characteristic, such as a hospital, school hostel, prison, defence force barracks or convent.
definition: A room equipped for the preparation of principal meals and intended for that purpose.

definition: A general term meaning the place where people stay. Living quarters can be divided into two main groups: housing units and collective living quarters. See also the diagram of types of living quarters in Appendix A.

zul: Isakhiwo okungesona esokuhlala/ isakhiwo esingasetshenziselwa ukuhlala
nso: Moago wa go se be wa madulo
tsn: Moago/kago o/e e seng wa/ya bonno
tso: Muako lowu nga endleriwangiki ku tshama vanhu
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A building where the major part of the floor space is not intended for dwelling but for other purposes such as commercial or industrial.

eng: Piped water in dwelling or on site
afr: Aangelegde water in woning of op perseel
xho: Amanzi asemibhobheni kwindawo yokuhlala okanye esizeni
nso: Meetse a pompi ka gae goba setsheng
sot: Metsi a pompo bodulong kapa setsheng
tsn: Metsi a thepe mo ntlong kgotsa mo setsheng
tso: Mati ya pompi eka vutshamo kumbe ndhawu
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Piped water inside the households own dwelling or in their yard. It excludes water from a neighbours tap or a public tap that is not on site.
definition: Payment for use of property of another as living quarters.
definition: Hotel providing semi-permanent accommodation. See tourist hotel.

definition: Space in a housing unit or other living quarters enclosed by walls reaching from the floor to the ceiling or roof covering, or to a height of at least two metres, of an area large enough to hold a bed for an adult, that is, at least four square metres.
definition: Principles and practices relating to the collection, removal or disposal of human excreta, household waste water and refuse, as they impact upon people and the environment.
definition: One of two houses joined together with one common wall. Each house usually has its own private ground and has no other dwelling below or above it.
definition: See dwelling, informal.
definition: See informal settlement.
definition: See erf.
definition: Person who occupies a housing unit which is not his/her property and who pays (in money or in kind) for using the unit as living quarters for his/her household.
definition: Arrangement under which a household occupies its dwelling.
definition: Installation or system for the disposal of human excreta.
definition: Installation or system for the disposal of human excreta.
definition: A hotel providing accommodation to short-term residents, e.g. tourists or other travellers such as business people. See residential hotel.
definition: A self-contained dwelling with private grounds within a common ground for other dwellings.

definition: A dwelling made of clay, mud, reeds or other locally available materials. Note: This is a general term that includes huts, rondavels, etc. Such dwellings can be found as single units or in clusters.
definition: One unit of electricity is equal to 1 kilowatt-hour (kWh). One gigawatt-hour (gWh) of electricity is equal to one million kilowatt-hours.

nso: Setsha/setene sa go se be le moago
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A stand, fenced or unfenced, which has no observable structure erected on it.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: Social Statistics / category: Housing and Services
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A communal living quarter for workers, provided by a public organisation such as a local authority, or a private organisation such as a mining company. These were residential dormitories established for migrant workers during the apartheid era, and they continue to house people working in certain industries, such as the mining industry.

ven: U shumisa / U a / U renga
eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: Income, Pensions, Spending and Wealth
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: To use or utilise services, spend money or eat or drink food.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: Income, Pensions, Spending and Wealth
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: An item received by the household from people who are not members of the household or items given away by members of the household to non-members, without compensation.

ven: U shumisa kana u kovhekanya tshelede
eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: Income, Pensions, Spending and Wealth
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The act of spending or disbursing money.

nso: Kamogelo ya sekoloto/ go dumela sekoloto
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A statement by a person/debtor in which he admits that he owes money to an individual or a company or a bank.
definition: Extensions to existing buildings as well as internal and external alterations of existing buildings.
definition: A statement of charges for a service rendered or for the amount owed.
definition: A decision taken in a civil matter or a dispute between two people or parties.
definition: Notice to appear before the court of law where a dispute between two parties or people has to be heard, i.e. not for a criminal offence.
definition: Cleaning using own staff or cleaning using subcontractors.

nso: Tswalelo ya kgwebo ka kgapeleto; phedio ya kgwebo ya kgapeleto
sot: Taelo ya kgotla ya kgapo ya thepa; kgapo e tlamang
tsn: Tswalokgwebo ka pateletso; phatlhalatsokgwebo ka pateletso
tso: Heriso wo boha wa khamphani hi nawu/ khoto
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Occurs when the affairs of a company or close corporation are wound up by order of the court.

nso: Kahlolo ya go amogelega/ kamogelo ya kahlolo
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Where a debtor agrees to subject himself/herself to obey or accept a judgement of a court against him for a debt he owes without defending the action. This usually happens before the debtor signs a binding contract, e.g. a loan agreement.

tsn: Katlholo ka itlhokomoloso; katlholo ka nyafalo
tso: Vuavanyisi munhu a nga ri kona
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Where the court gives a judgement or a ruling against the defendant who is not present in court and was previously given a notice that was ignored, i.e. a judgement was given against a party or an individual while not present in court.

tso: Ku rhumela ematikweni ya le handle
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Outward flow of goods and services leaving the economic territory of a country to the outside world.

nso: Thomelomahala ya dithoto go twa le go ya dinageng di ele
tso: Nhundzu yo pfumala tihakelo etikweni hi lwandle
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Relates to goods destined for the export market. Railage, road transport and docking charges are involved, but no charges are made for transport by sea.

tso: Nhundzu yo pfumala tihakelo etikweni hi xitimela
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Relates to goods sold on the local market where no railage or road transport costs are involved.

sot: Gigawatt ka hora ; hora ya gigawatt
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: One gigawatt-hour of electricity is equal to one million kilowatt-hours. A kilowatt-hour is the basic unit of electrical energy equal to one kilowatt of power supplied to or taken from an electric circuit steadily for one hour. One kilowatt-hour equals one thousand watt-hours.
definition: Inward flow of goods and services entering the economic territory of a country from the outside world.

eng: Index of physical volume of electricity production
afr: Indeks van fisiese volume van elektrisiteitsproduksie
nso: Kelo ya thupeto ya tweleto ya mohlagase lebakeng le itego
tso: Xikombo xa vholumu ya mbonakalo ya andziso wa gezi
eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: Industry and Trade Statistics / category: Industry and Trade
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A statistical measure of the change in the volume of production of electricity in a given period and the volume of production of electricity in the base period.
ven_pos_or_descriptor: Mbalombalo / Zwitatisitika zwa Nowetshumo na Mbambadzo / Vhubindudzi

eng: Index of physical volume of manufacturing production
afr: Indeks van fisiese volume van fabrieksproduksie
tso: Xikombo xa vholumu ya mbonakalo na andziso wa vumaki
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A statistical measure of the change in the volume of production. The production index of a major group is the ratio between the volume of production of a major group in a given period and the volume of production of the same major group in the base period.

eng: Index of physical volume of mining production
afr: Indeks van fisiese volume van mynbouproduksie
nso: Kelothupeto ya tweleto ya dirafwa lebakeng le itego
tso: Xikombo xa vholumu ya mbonakalo ya andziso wa migodi
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A statistical measure of the change in the volume of production. The production index of a mineral group is the ratio between the volume of production of a mineral group in a given period and the volume of production of the same mineral group in the base period.

definition: A state whereby an individual or partnership is unable to pay its debt and is placed under final sequestration; a partnership which is unable to pay its debt is regarded as one insolvency, irrespective of the number of partners.
definition: A sale transaction where a person buys goods on credit and pays for them in installments, e.g. every week or month, until he/she settles the debt.

nso: Tswalelo ya kgwebo/ hlahlamollo ya kgwebo
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The winding-up of the affairs of a company or close corporation when liabilities exceed assets and it can be resolved by voluntary action or by an order of the court.
definition: People who take part in court proceedings, usually against each other, like a debtor and a creditor.

sot: Phetisetso ya nyewe kgotleng le leng; baqosani ba fetisetswa pele
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A case where the parties have been referred to another instance/court.

eng: Net profit or loss before tax
afr: Netto wins of verlies voor belasting
nbl: Inzuzo eseleko namkha ilahleko ngaphambi komthelo
zul: Isamba senzuzo noma sencitheko ngaphambi kokukhokhwa kwentela
nso: Maaledi a poelo le tobo pele ga mothelo
sot: Phaello ya sebele/tahlehelo pele ho lekgetho
tsn: Poelotota kgotsa tatlhegelotota pele ga lekgetho
ven: Mbuelo kana ndozwo / tsalelamurahu ha lutho / muthelo
tso: Mbuyeloxiheri kumbe ndzahlekelo ku nga si tekiwa xibalo
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The difference between total income and total expenditure before providing for drawings by proprietors or partners, company or dividends.

nso: Kgwebiano ya akhaonte ya go bulega
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: An account that does not have a final payment date and a person can always take more goods and keep paying as long as he has credit (also known as revolving credit).

tsn: Melato e mengwe; dikoloto tse dingwe
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: All other kinds of outstanding debts such as salaries and wages, outstanding medical fund debts, outstanding sponsored debts, outstanding class and tuition debt, outstanding income and sales, tax, outstanding assessment rates, outstanding money in respect of television maintenance contracts, and outstanding money in respect of flat levies.

sot: Mabaka a mang a kgaello ya tshebediso
ven: Zwiwe zwiitisi / zwivhangi zwa tshaedza-/ hahedzatshumiso
tso: Swivangelo swinwana swa matirhiselo ya le hansi
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Other reasons include reasons such as downtime due to maintenance, lower productivity and seasonal factors.

definition: Include institutions for the disabled, boarding houses, old-age homes, hostels, hotels, motels, guest-houses, holiday chalets, bed-and-breakfast accommodation, entertainment centres and casinos.
definition: Refers to municipal services (except outstanding assessment rates), plumbers, builders, mechanics, panel-beaters and electricians.

xho: Ipesenti yokusetyenziswa ngokungaphelelanga komthamo olindelweyo wemveliso
nso: Phesente ya terionene ya mothamo wa tweleto
sot: Phesente ya kgaello ya tshebediso ya bokgoni tlhahisong

tso: Ntirhiso wa le hansi wa vundzeni bya andziso hi tiphesente
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The percentage under-utilisation of production capacity is calculated by deducting the percentage utilisation of production capacity from a hundred.

sot: Phesente ya tshebediso ya bokgoni tlhahisong
ven: Phesenthe kha ana ya tshumiso ya vhukoni ha vhubveledzi
tso: Ntirhiso wa le hansi wa vundzeni bya andziso hi tiphesente
eng_pos_or_descriptor: manufacturing industry / category: Industry and Trade
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A measure of the use of manpower, plant and machinery in manufacturing.
definition: See Platinum Group Metals.
definition: A person/party in a civil case who asks the court for judgement against another person.

ven: Mitale / methala ya tshigwada tsha pulatinamu
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Include platinum; iridium; osmiridium; palladium; rhodium; ruthenium and osmium.
definition: Medical doctors/dentists, advocates/attorneys, auditors/ accountants, architects, engineers and hospital services.
definition: Written note, signed by one person, in which he promises to pay money to another person or to the bearer of such a note on a specific date or on demand.
definition: See refer-to-drawer cheques.
definition: Foreign goods exported in the same state as previously imported.
definition: One calendar month.

nso: Theke ya go buetwa go mong
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Dishonoured cheques. The drawer is the owner of the cheque. When a person issues a cheque and there is no money in the cheque account, the bank will refuse to pay the bearer. The cheque will be referred back to the drawer.

nso: Kgwebo ya go rekia go badirii
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Includes the resale (sale without transformation) of new and used goods and products to the general public for household use.
definition: An enterprise deriving more than 50% of its turnover from sales of goods to the general public for household use.

ven: Tshigwada tsha zwi fanaho zwi linganaho
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A stratum is constructed by concatenating the SIC classification and size group variables.

tsn: Tswalokgwebo ka boithaopo; phatlhalatsokgwebo ka boithaopo
tso: Heriso wa khamphani hi ku tinyiketela
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: When a company or close corporation, by own choice, resolves to wind up its affairs.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: manufacturing major group / category: Industry and Trade
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The overall index for manufacturing is the ratio of the value added of the major group (i.e. output of a major group minus intermediate consumption) to the total value added of the manufacturing industry. The weight reflects the importance of the major group in the total. The weights change over time due to changes in the relative performance of industries, due to factors such as quality changes, changes in relative prices, and changes in customer preferences. New weights need to be calculated from time to time.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: mineral group / category: Industry and Trade
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The ratio of the sales of a mineral group to the total sales of the mining industry. The weight of a mineral group reflects the importance of the mineral group in the total mining industry. The weights change over time due to quality changes and changes in relative prices. New weights need to be calculated from time to time.
definition: An enterprise deriving 50% or more of its turnover from sales of goods to other businesses and institutions.

definition: Resale (sale without transformation) of new and used goods and products to other wholesalers, retailers, agricultural, industrial, commercial, institutional and professional users, either directly or through agents on a fee or contract basis.

afr: Daadwerklike stappe om werk te soek
nso: Matsapa a mahlahla a go nyaka moomo
tso: Magoza yo gingirikela ku lava ntirho
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Steps such as registration at an employment exchange, applications to employers, checking at work sites or farms, placing or answering newspaper advertisements, seeking assistance of friends, etc.

eng: Average monthly earnings at constant 2000 prices
nbl: Ingeniso yenyanga eyi-avareji ejame eentengweni zika-2000
xho: Iavareji yengeniso ngenyanga exabiso limi kunyaka wama-2000
zul: Isilinganisomvama/ i-avareji yomihlomulo ngenyanga entengweni engaguquki onyaka we-2000
nso: Palogare ya megolo ya kgwedi go ya ka ditheko ta 2000
sot: Palohare ya kuno kgweding ho ya ka ditheko tse tsitsitseng tsa 2000
tsn: Palogare ya lotseno lwa kgwedi ka ditlhotlhwa tse di tsepameng tsa 2000
