tso: Mpimoxikarhi wa miholo ya nhweti eka mixavo leyi nga cinciki ya 2000
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Measure of change in average monthly earnings after the direct effects of inflation have been eliminated. The deflator used to devalue the current average earnings is the Consumer Price Index (2000=100).

eng: Average monthly earnings at current prices
afr: Gemiddelde maandelikse verdienste teen huidige pryse
xho: Iavareji yengeniso ngenyanga ngamaxabiso asebenzayo/ akhoyo
zul: Isilinganisomvama/ i-avareji syemali engenayo entengweni yangaleso sikhathi
nso: Palogare ya megolo ya kgwedi ka ditheko ta bjale
sot: Palohare ya kuno kgweding dithekong tsa jwale
tsn: Palogare ya lotseno lwa kgwedi ka ditlhotlhwa tsa gajaana
ven: Mbuelotshikati dza wedzi kha mitengo ya zwino
tso: Avhareji ya miholo ya nhweti eka minxavo ya sweswi
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Are calculated by dividing the total gross earnings, excluding severance, termination and redundancy payments, for the reference month by the number of employees as at the end of the reference month.

tsn: Bathapiwa ba nakwana; badiri ba nakwana
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Employees who are typically working daily or hourly, whose services can be dispensed with at a very short notice, usually not exceeding a period of one week, and who are not entitled to benefits such as paid leave and medical aid contributions paid by employers.
definition: The job in which a person is engaged during the survey reference period.

sot: Mmatli ya nyahameng wa mosebetsi; mmatlamosebetsi ya nyahamenng
tso: Munhu la nyameke ku lava ntirho
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Person without work, who wants to work but has not taken active steps to seek work in the reference period.
definition: A person employed to work in a household as a cleaner, cook, nanny driver, gardener, etc. See live-in domestic worker under Census.

definition: (1) Any activity that contributes to the production of goods and services (contrasted with non-economic activity such as study or leisure).
(2) The main business of an enterprise. See industry.

sot: Indasteri ya moruo; lekala la tsa moruo
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Deprecated. Use industry.
definition: Measure of the level of economic well-being of individuals, for which income and ownership of assets are commonly used.

nso: Motho wa maloka a go oma
sot: Motho ya nang le seabo moruong
tso: Munhu loyi a gingirikelaka ku tirha
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A person of working age who is available for work, and is either employed, or is unemployed but has taken active steps to find work in the reference period. See not economically active population and unemployed person.

definition: Educational level is aggregated into no formal education, primary school (grade 1 to grade 7), secondary school (grade 8 to grade 12) diploma or certificate without grade 12 (from lower to grade 11), diploma or certificate with grade 12, degree and other post-graduate degree.

definition: Those who performed work for pay, profit or family gain for at least one hour in the seven days prior to the interview or who were absent from work during these seven days, but did have some form of paid work to return to.
definition: A person who performs work for pay, profit or family gain in the reference point, or who was absent from work but had to work to return to. See employee.
definition: A person (permanently, temporarily or casually employed) who normally works the agreed hours in his/her present job.
tso_pos_or_descriptor: Mushumo na Mitengo / vuthori na mixavo

nso: Meongwana ya moomi ka putseleto ya go se fetoge
sot: Mosebetsi wa bahiruwa ka dihlapiso tse tsitsitseng
tsn: Tiro ka tshuiso/phimolakeledi e e tsepameng
ven: Mushumi/ mutholwa /muhirwa kha mushumo wa ndilisotiwa
tso: Mpimo wa vanhu lava ringaneleke ku tirha hi ndziriso lowu nga cinciki
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The current labour input at the levels of compensation of employees jobs ruling during a selected base period (1993 SNA93).

definition: All compensation of employees, full-time and part-time, irrespective of whether the remuneration is paid out of revenue, capital or any other account.
Note:
Inclusions:
 Basic compensation
 Allowances
 Contribution to other benefit funds of employees such as medical aid, pension fund
 Contribution to other benefit funds of employees such as medical aid, pension fund
contributions, group life, etc.
Exclusions:
 Unemployment insurance
 Workmens compensation
 Other benefits such as housing subsidy etc.
 Uniform clothing and allowances allowances to councillors
definition: A person or organisation that uses the services of one or more people for pay in cash or kind.
definition: An activity in which a person performs work for pay, profit or family gain. Such a person can be self-employed, an employer, an employee or a working family member.

nso: Moomo wa go se be wa semolao
tso: Ntirho, lowu nga riki wa ximfumo
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Employment that takes place in a business or organisation not registered for income tax or VAT.

eng: Employment to population ratio / labour absorption rate
nso: Reio / Reiti ya thwalo / Khiro ya batho
sot: Karolo ya ba sebetsang lekgolong ho ba dilemong tsa ho sebetsa
tsn: Kabopapiso ya badiri malebana le baagi
tso: Matholele ku ya hi mpimoxiave wa vanhu / Mpimo wa matholele ya vatirhi
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: See labour absorption rate
definition: A benefit to ones family as a result of working, other than pay to oneself, for example, housing or use of land.

sot: Indasteri e molaong; lekala le molaong
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Sector of employment made up of all employing businesses that are registered in any way.

tsn: Mmereko o o feletseng; tiro e e feletseng
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Situation when the economy is producing to its maximum sustainable capacity, using labour, technology, land, capital and other factors of production to their fullest potential.
definition: Employee (permanent, temporary or casual) who normally works the agreed hours for a full days work, or, if agreed hours do not apply, for at least 35 hours a week.

definition: Payments for ordinary-time, standard or agreed hours and over-time hours during the reference period for all permanent, temporary, casual, executive and managerial employers/employees before taxation and other deductions. Inclusions: Payments in kind to farming employees such as meals, rations and free housing, but excluding rations and bonuses to farming contractors and their employees.
definition: The total time spent producing goods and services, including overtime, during the reference period.

definition: All money received from sales of goods, services rendered, mineral rights leases; rental of land, buildings and other structures, plant, machinery, and motor vehicles; interest and dividends, royalties, franchise fees, copyright, trade names and patens rights, government subsidies and incentives, net profit on foreign loans, profit from redemption, liquidation or revaluation of liabilities, profile from the sale of realisation for cash or revaluation.

definition: All money received from salary, wages or own business; plus money benefits from employer, such as contributions to medical aid and pension funds; plus all money from other sources, such as additional work activities, remittances from family members living elsewhere, state pension or grant, other pensions or grants, income from investments, etc.

tso: Ntholo wo ka wu nga ri wa ximfumo
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: It includes all persons in the informal sector. Employees in the formal sector and persons employed in private households who are NOT entitled to basic benefits such as pensions or medical aid are also included.

nso: Lefapa la go se be la semolao
tso: Xiyenge xo kala xi nga ri xa ximfumo
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The informal sector consists of those businesses that are not registered in any way. They are generally small in nature, and are seldom run from business premises. Instead, they are generally run from homes, street pavements and other informal arrangements.

definition: A job comprises filled posts. One person may have more than one job. The LFS asks additional questions of multiple jobholders to get information, at least, about their primary and secondary jobs. On the other hand, QES covers the number of employed persons in enterprises/establishments, which do not know whether their employees have other jobs. Aggregating figures on employed persons over firms measure jobs not persons. Social security records or tax registrations might be another way of showing the relation between jobs and persons (ILO and Stats SA).

definition: Unemployed person who had a job, but does not have one anymore because of their own decision.
Examples of reasons:
 Pregnancy
 Family / community responsibilities
 Going to school
 Changed residence
 Retired
 Other reasons

ven: Muxelelwa nga mushumo / Mufhelelwa nga mushumo
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info:
definition: Unemployed person who had a job, but does not have one anymore because of reasons beyond their control.
Examples of reasons:
 Lost their job
 Their job had ended
 They were laid off
 The business in which they had previously worked had been sold or had closed down

sot: Karolo ya bahiruwa; sekgahla sa kgiro ya basebetsi
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The proportion of the working-age population that is employed.
definition: A statistical system of core variables on labour that consists of a set of tables providing a systematic and consistent overview, mutually and over time, of the core variables (ILO).
definition: All the expenses incurred by the employer for a particular task to be completed (ILO).
definition: All employed and unemployed persons of working age.

nso: Kelo ya boteakarolo bja lebotho/ lekoko la baomi
tso: Mpimo wo hoxa xandla xa vanhu lava ringaneleke ku tirha
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: See labour participation rate.
definition: All persons aged 1564 years who are employed, unemployed and not economically active (inactive).

tso: Ku cinca ka swiyimo swa timakete ta vatirhi
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Movement into, out of, and within the labour market over a specified time period.

ven: Thitho tshiimo tsha tshigwada tsha vhalugelamushumo
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Classification as employed, unemployed or not economically active.

nso: Kelo ya go tea karolo ga baomi
tso: Mpimo wa ku hoxa xandla wa vanhu lava ringaneleke ku tirha
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The percentage of the working-age population that is economically active (employed and unemployed), i.e. labour force/labour market. Synonym is labour force participation rate.

nso: Mengwaga ya maloka a go oma
sot: Dilemo tsa molao tsa ho sebetsa
tsn: Dingwaga tsa go dira tsa semolao
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: See working age, legal.

ven: U valelwa/u thivhela vhathu u shuma ngau vha valela nna
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info:
definition: A work stoppage in which an employer prevents some or all employees from working, even to the extent of closing the business.
Note: This usually happens when there is a dispute between the employer and employees.

nso: Go se ome ga lebaka le letelele
sot: Ho se sebetse nako e telele
ven: U fhedza tshifhinga tshilapfu u sa shumi
tso: Ku pfumala ntirho nkarhi wo leha
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The status of a person who has been unemployed for a period of twelve months or more.

sot: Mesebetsi ya tlhahiso bakeng la mmaraka
ven: Mushumo wa vhubveledzi ha mbambadzo / Nyito ya vhubveledzi ha mbambadzo
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Activities associated with the production of goods and services for sale. Government services are also included. See economic activities.

sot: Motho ya kenang dipalong tsa ba so kang ba sebetsa
tso: Munhu loyi a nga si tshamaka a tirha
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Unemployed people who have never worked before.

nso: Mekgatlo ye e sego ya mmuo
sot: Mekgatlo eo e seng ya mmuso
tso: Nhlangano wo ka wu nga ri wa mfumo
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Institutions which are not established or operated by government. NGOs are usually private, non-profit entities which are run by their members.

nso: Ditiro ta tweleto ye e sego ya mmaraka
sot: Mesebetsi ya tlhahiso bakeng la tshebediso ya lelapa
ven: Mishumo ya u bveledza zwi sa rengiswi
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Activities associated with the production of goods and services for household consumption.

afr: Bevolking wat nie ekonomies aktief is nie
nso: Sethaba sa go hloka maloka a go oma
tsn: Batho ba ba se nang seabe mo ikonoming
tso: Vanhu lava nga kumekiki ku tirha
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: People who are not available for work, such as full-time scholars and students, full-time homemakers, those who are retired and those who are unable or unwilling to work.
definition: The type of work a person does according to the South African Classification of Occupations, irrespective of the industry.
definition: Occupational groups are divided into eleven groups; for example, senior managers, professionals, technicians, services workers, labourers, etc. (Stats SA).

eng: Official and expanded definition of unemployment
afr: Amptelike en uitgebreide definisie van werkloosheid
nso: Tlhalookatolowa ya semmuo ya ba go hloka moomo le ba go se ome
sot: Tlhaloso ya semmuso le e ekeditsweng ya ho se sebetse
tsn: Thanolo ya semmuso e e atolositsweng ya botlhokatiro

tso: Nhlamuselo ya ximfumo na yo ndlandlamuxiwa ya ku nga tirhi
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Stats SA uses the following definition of unemployment as its official definition: The unemployed are those people within the economically active population who: (a) did not work during the seven days prior to the interview, (b) want to work and are available to start work within two weeks of the interview, and (c) have taken active steps to look for work or start some form of self-employment in the four weeks prior to the interview. The expanded definition of unemployment excludes criterion (c).

sot: Ka thoko ho mmaraka wa mosebetsi
tsn: Batho ba ba sa siamelang/lekaneng go dira
tso: Vanhu lava nga kumekiki ku tirha
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: See not economically active population.

nso: Nako ye e okeditwego; phitianako ya moomo
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Hours worked in excess of ordinary time, standard or agreed hours.

nbl: Ama-awa wesikhathi eseqileko / we- ovathayimu abhadaliweko
xho: Iiyure zokusebenza ezihlawuliweyo zexesha elingaphezu kwelimiselweyo
nso: Diiri ta nako ye e okeditwego ta moomo
sot: Dihora tse lefellwang tsa nako e ekeditsweng
tsn: Diura tsa nakotlolo/nakopheteledi tse di duelelwang
ssw: Ema-awa/ ema-ova lakhokhelwe, ema-awa esikhatsi lesengcelele lakhokhelwe
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Those hours worked in excess of ordinary-time hours, standard or agreed hours of work that was paid for in the reference period.

nso: Meputso ya nako ye e okeditwego
tsn: Dituelo tsa nakotlolo; dituelo tsa nakopheteledi
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Payment for hours worked and paid for in excess of ordinary-time hours, standard or agreed hours worked for the reference period. Penalty payments that relate to overtime are also included.
definition: Preferred term is self-employed.

nso: Moomo wa ka gae wo o lefelwago
ven: Mushumo wa nuni une wa badelwa
tso: Ntirho wa le kaya lowu hakelaka
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Work done in a private household for a cash payment.
definition: Employee (permanent, temporary, casual or seasonal) who normally works less than 35 hours per week.

ven: Muthelo zwi tshi ya nga muholo
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: An amount collected by employers on behalf of the government from employees whose net remuneration from employment exceeds a predefined amount.
definition: An approach that takes into account the total payments made for goods and services during a given period, whether or not they were delivered in that period.

nso: Tefo ye e sego ya thelete
ven: Malamba a si a masheleni / Mbadelo i si ya masheleni
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A kind of payment other than cash for work undertaken.

eng: Pensioner {definition: Any person of pensionable age A person who draws a pension from a previous employer or pension fund, or who 2)A person who draws a pension from a previous employer or pension fund, or who receives a state pension.}

xho: Iibhonasi zokugqwesa emsebenzini nezinye/ zomsebenzi oncomekayo nezinye
nso: Diputseleto ta bokgoni le te dingwe
sot: Dibonase tsa tshebetso le tse ding
tsn: Dikatso tsa tiragatsophetelela le tse dingwe
ven: Mbadelo dza ndivhamashumele na dziwe nyingambadelo / bonasi
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Performance and other bonuses cover seasonal, end-of-year and one-time bonuses and additional payments supplementary to normal payments. Note: They include profit-sharing bonuses, merit bonuses, incentive bonuses, and total amounts of payments that were paid during the reference period but relate to other pay periods, e.g. annual leave, thirteenth cheques. Performance and other bonuses exclude reimbursements for expenses incurred whilst conducting employers business.

tsn: Mothapiwa wa leruri; modiredi wa leruri
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: An employee appointed on an open-ended contract with no stipulated termination date, and who is entitled to benefits such as paid leave and medical aid contributions paid by employers. This excludes the self-employed at work.

nso: Moomi yo a sa omelego mogolo/moputso
tsn: Motho yo o sa siamelang /lekanelang go dira
ven: Muthu a re nna ha vhalugelamushumo
tso: Munhu loyi a nga weliki ehansi ka vanhu lava ringaneleke ku tirha
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A person who performs unpaid work such as household work, caring for household members and purchasing goods and services for the household (ILO).
definition: A set of tasks, which are (designed to be) carried out by one person. Post may be vacant (ILO).

sot: Motho ya kenang kgetlo la bobedi dipalong tsa ba sa sebetseng
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Unemployed persons who worked before, and were not economically active before they started looking for work.
definition: The major part of income from employment which also contains the income from self-employment (ILO).

nso: Mogolo wa baomedi; moputso wa baomedi; tefelo ya baomedi
tsn: Tuelo ya bathapiwa; moputso wa bathapiwa; mogolo wa bathapiwa
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Total cost of employment, including salaries, wages, service and other bonuses, allowances (including car allowances), overtime payments, retirement benefits, contributions to medical, pension and provident funds, unemployment insurance and accident funds, and housing subsidies.

sot: Motho ya seng a sa sebetse; mophenshenara
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A person who has stopped doing regular work regardless of age. See pensioner.
definition: Regular payments for work performed.

definition: The amount an employer pays an employee for work done. It is a fixed income for services, which is usually paid on a weekly, bi-weekly or monthly basis, unlike a wage, which is generally paid on an hourly basis. The salary of an employee is usually specified in an employment contract.
definition: A person who works for himself/herself for pay, profit or family gain, and not for an employer. See employee, employed person.

sot: Motho ya nang le tsebo e haellang ya mosebetsi; mohiruwa wa kwetliso e sa phathahalang
tso: Mutirhi loyi a nga na xikilinyana
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A person who acquired his/her expertise through a relatively short training period (single days or weeks) after which the required tasks should be efficiently performed. He/she must possess basic literacy and numeracy skills prior to training, but primary education is sufficient as a prerequisite for training.

sot: Ditefo tsa kgaohano, phediso le phokotso
ssw: Imbadalo/ inkhokhelo yekucedza budlelwane, yekuyekela nekuphelelwa ngumsebenti
tso: Tihakelo to tshika, na ku nga pfuni nchumu entirhweni
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Include payments of accumulated leave made to employees who finished work during the reference quarter as well as payments intended to compensate for loss of employment.

tsn: Mothapiwa yo o nang le bokgoni; mothapiwa yo o nonofileng
tso: Mutirhi loyi a nga na xikili
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A person who has undergone training or education in and/or outside his/her work environment and who is in possession of a minimum level of secondary qualification to qualify for their occupation. An employee in this category must have undergone at least two years study or training after having completed grade 12.

xho: inkxaso-mali yabasebenzi ehlawulweyo umrhumo womqeshi kwiimfanelo zabasebenzi
nso: Diputseleto ta leago te di lefetwego
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Actual or imputed payment made by general government units to social insurance scheme to obtain entitlement to social benefits to their employees, including pensions and other retirement benefits.

xho: inkxaso-mali yabasebenzi efunyenweyo imirhumo efunyenwe kwabazilungiselela ikamva
nso: Diputseleto ta leago te di amogetwego
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info:
definition: Actual or imputed receipts from either employers on behalf of their employees or from employees, self-employed, or non-employed persons on their own behalf that secure entitlement to social benefits for the contributors, their dependants or their survivors.
The contributions may be compulsory or voluntary.
definition: Absence from work (e.g. on annual or sick leave), when there is the intention to return to work and the person has work to return to.

definition: An employee appointed on a short-term contract basis for periods normally not exceeding one year. Such contract would typically stipulate a termination date, but could be renewed by mutual agreement between the employer and the employee. This excludes the self-employed person with an enterprise but temporarily not at work.

ven: U awedzwa lwa tshifhinganyana / U litshiswa mushumo lwa tshifhinganyana
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Employees being laid off work for at least one complete working day because there is not enough work for them to do.

definition: A person who (a) did not work in the seven days prior to the reference point, and (b) wants to work and is available to start work within two weeks* of the reference point. There are no work-seeking criteria. This category comprises the unemployed according to the strict definition plus discouraged work-seekers. (*The availability period changed from one week to two weeks in July 2004.)

eng_pos_or_descriptor: official or strict definition / category: Labour
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Person within the economically active population who (a) did not work in the seven days prior to the reference point, (b) wants to work and is available to start work within two weeks* of the reference point, and (c) has taken active steps to look for work or start some form of self-employment in the four days prior to the reference point. (*The availability period changed from one week to two weeks in July 2004.)

definition: People within the economically active population, who: (a) Did not work during the seven days prior to the interview (b) Want to work and are available to start work within two weeks of the interview (c) Have taken active steps to look for work or to start some form of self-employment in the four weeks prior to the interview (ILO and Stats SA).

nso: Sekhwama sa inorentshe ya ge o feletwe ke moomo
sot: Letlole la inshorense ya ho se sebetse / Letlole la inshorense bakeng la ba sa tswa fellwa ke mosebetsi
ven: Tshikwama tsha Ndiliso tsha Vhashumi / Tshikwama tsha Ndindakhombo tsha Vhashumi
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info:
definition: A fund to which employers and employees contribute and from which employees who become unemployed (or their beneficiaries) are entitled to benefits.
Note: The intention of the fund is to alleviate the harmful economic and social effects of unemployment.
definition: The percentage of the economically active population that is unemployed.

nso: Baomi ba go hloka bokgoni/ ba go se hlahliwe
tsn: Bathapiwa ba ba se nang bokgoni; bathapiwa ba ba sa nonofang
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Persons who have not undergone any formal training or of whom no minimum level of education is required.
definition: Available funded positions/posts for immediate filling on the survey reference date and for which recruitment action had been taken (ILO).

ven: Tshikhala vhuimo ha mushumo/ poswo tshayamuthu
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A post available in a department for which there is no candidate to occupy (ILO).
definition: Compensation a worker receives in exchange for their labour. See Salary.
definition: Any activity carried out by an individual, and whose product contributes to the national output, irrespective of whether the person doing it is paid (cash or in kind) or not paid.
definition: Self-employed persons, employers and employees.

nso: Mengwaga ya maswanedi a go oma
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Between 15 and 65 years inclusive. For historical reasons, the upper limit in Stats SA practice is 65 and not 64 as elsewhere. See working age, legal.

nso: Mengwaga ya maswanedi a go oma
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A person aged 15 or above.

nso: Sethaba sa ba mengwaga ya maswanedi a go oma
sot: Setjhaba se dilemong tsa ho sebetsa
tsn: Baagi ba dingwaga tsa go dira
ven: Vhathu vha murole wa u shuma
tso: Vanhu lava nga na malembe lawa ya ringaneleke ku tirha
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: All persons aged 1565 years.
definition: Payments made by one spouse to a separated or divorced spouse as required by a court order.
definition: An amount owed by / to a person or organisation for funds borrowed.
definition: An individual or company that owes debt to another (the creditor).
definition: Tax levied on the financial income of a person, cooperation or other legal entity.

nso: Mothelo Tekanywa wa Letseno la Baomi
sot: Lekgetho la kuno / Lekeno le behilweng la basebetsi
ven: Muthelo wa Mbuelo wa Ndinganyiso wa Vhashumi
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: People whose net remuneration from employment exceeds R60 000 per annum (i.e income and benefits after tax) are required to pay both SITE and Pay As You Earn (PAYE). People whose net remuneration is R60 000 or below are required to pay SITE only.

sot: Mesebetsi ya tlhahiso bakeng la mmaraka
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Activities associated with production of goods and services for sale. See economic activities.

definition: A tool which records, for given aspects of economic life: (a) The uses and resources; or (b) The changes in assets and the changes in liabilities; and/or (c) The stock of assets and liabilities existing at a certain time. Transaction accounts include a balancing item which is used to equate the two sides of the accounts (e.g. resources and uses) and which is a meaningful measure of economic performance in itself.
definition: A supporting activity undertaken to create the conditions within which the activities of an enterprise are carried out.

definition: An accounting construct obtained by subtracting the total value of the entries on one side of an account from the total value of the entries on the other side. Note: Balancing items are not simply devices introduced to ensure that accounts balance. They encapsulate a great deal of information and include some of the most important entries in the accounts, for example value added and operating surplus.

definition: The amounts receivable by the producer from the purchaser for a unit of a good or service produced as output minus any tax payable plus any subsidy receivable on that unit as a consequence of its production or sale. Note: Basic prices exclude any transport charges invoiced separately by the producer. A basic price is the preferred method of valuing output.
definition: Those years in respect of which authoritative and detailed data are available.

tsn: Bayota; dimela le diphologolo tsa lefelo le le rileng
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Refers to the flora and fauna of a specific region or country.
definition: Value of wealth in the form of money, human resources or property owned by a person or business.
definition: The transfer of ownership of an asset (other than inventories or cash) or the cancellation of a liability by a creditor.
definition: Payment of cash or the equivalent of cash.
definition: An area on which rain falls and from which the water runs into a particular river.
definition: Method used to track the flow of goods and services from the supply (domestic production or imported) to the use (intermediate consumption, final consumption or exports) thereof.

definition: The total remuneration, in cash or kind, payable by an employer to an employee in return for work done by the latter during the accounting period. Note: It is recorded on a gross basis, i.e. before any deduction for income taxes, pensions, unemployment insurance and other social insurance schemes. It also includes other forms of compensation, namely commissions, tips, bonuses, directors fees and allowances such as those for holidays and sick leave, as well as military pay and allowances. It excludes employers social contributions.

nso: Ditheko ta go se fetoge nako e itego
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A valuation concept expressed at the prices prevailing during a fixed reference period or base period.
definition: An activity in which institutional units use up goods and services. It can be either intermediate or final.

xho: Ixabiso lentengo, i-inshorensi kunye nentlawulo yothutho
zul: Inani lezindleko, umshuwalense kanye nokuthuthwa kwempahla
ven: Mutengo wa ndindakhombo ya tshinyalelo na vhuendisi ha zwiunwa
tso: Tihakelo ta ndhurho, ndzindzakhombo na ta ntiko
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The price of goods delivered at the frontier of the importing country, or the price of services delivered to residents, before payment of any import duties or other taxes on imports or trade and transport margins within the country.

nso: Oli ye tala; oli ya go se hlotlwe; leokwane
tsn: Oli e tala; oli e e sa tlhotlhwang
ven: Ole i songo kuniswaho / kunaho / ole mbisi
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A mineral oil consisting of a mixture of hydrocarbons of natural origins; yellow to black in colour and of variable viscosity.
definition: All transfers that are not classified as capital transfers. They directly affect the level of disposable income and should influence the consumption of goods and services.

nso: Thutio ya thelete/matlotlo; thutio ya thelete/matlotlo
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: All transfers that are not classified as capital transfers. They directly affect the level of disposable income and should influence the consumption of goods and services.

definition: May be a corporation (a quasi-corporate enterprise is treated as if it is a corporation in the 1993 SNA), a non-profit institution or an unincorporated enterprise. Corporate enterprises and non-profit institutions are complete institutional units. An unincorporated enterprise, however, refers to an institutional unit  a household or government unit  only in its capacity as a producer of goods and services. It covers only those activities of the unit which are directed towards the production of goods and services.

sot: Tlhophiso ya diakhaonto tsa tikoloho; kakaretso ya diakhaonte tsa tikoloho
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The combination of natural resource accounts, which consist of stock and flow accounts in physical terms, and the monetary valuation of these accounts.

definition: An enterprise, or part of an enterprise, that is situated at a single location and in which only a single (non-ancillary) productive activity is carried out or in which the principal productive activity accounts for most of the value added.
definition: The combined loss of water by evaporation from soil or surface water and transpiration from plants and animals.

definition: A valuation concept reflecting the cost of the factors of production (labour and capital). It corresponds to the value remaining after all applicable taxes and subsidies have been deducted from market prices.

nso: Sekgoba sa moomo se se tladitwego
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Post for which an employee has been appointed.

definition: Different components of final demand are distinguished in the SU-tables. The supply table shows imports and the Qualified shows final consumption expenditure by households and the general government as well as gross capital formation (gross fixed capital formation and changes in inventories) and exports.

nso: Ditirelo ta matlotlo ta go elwa ka go se otlologe
sot: Ditshebeletso tsa ditjhelete tse sa lekanngwang ka kotloloho
tsn: Ditirelotlotlo tse di sa lekanyediwang ka tlhamalalo
ven: Tshumelo dza masheleni/tshelede dzo elwaho lu songo livhiswaho
tso: Vukorhokeri bya timali lebyi pimiweke hi ku nga kongomi
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Measured in the SNA as the total property income receivable by financial intermediaries minus their total interest payable, excluding the value of any property income receivable from the investment of their own funds.

nso: Tefo go morekii ka moamogedi mollwaneng
sot: Ditheko tsa thomello tse sa lefellweng
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The purchasers' price paid by an importer taking delivery of goods at the exporters frontier after loading on to a carrier and after payment of any export taxes or the receipt of any tax rebates.

nso: Tekanyo le diiri ta moomo wa goya goile
tsn: Dilekani tsa nako e e tletseng
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The ratio of the total number of hours worked and the average number of hours worked in full-time jobs. Note: When an estimation of the number of hours worked is available, it is obviously used as the numerator. If an estimation of the average hours worked in a full-time job is not available, estimates of average contractual hours in full-time jobs can be used as the denominator (ILO). Full-time equivalents are defined as the total hours worked divided by average annual hours worked in full-time jobs (1993 SNA).
definition: See gross domestic product.

nso: GDP dithekong ta go se fetoge nakong ye e itego
tsn: KSA ka ditlhotlhwa tse di tsepameng
tso: SHT hi mixavo leyi nga cinciki
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The value of goods and services of a given year, using the prices of a determined base (reference) year. Synonym is real prices.
definition: The value of goods and services using the prices at the time of the transaction. Synonym is nominal GDP.
definition: The value of goods and services excluding indirect taxes on production such as sales tax, excise duties.
definition: Total gross value added at basic prices plus taxes on products minus subsidies on products.

definition: A production measure obtained through the sum of the gross values added of all resident institutional units, in their capacity as producers, plus the values of any taxes, less subsidies, on production or imports not already included in the values of the outputs and- values added by resident producers. (Equal to GDP at market prices.)
definition: The sum of gross value added by all industries at basic prices plus taxes on products minus subsidies on products in a region.

definition: The generation of income account provides for the distribution of primary incomes to the various institutional sectors. Primary incomes are incomes that accrue to institutional sectors and industries as a consequence of their involvement in processes of production or ownership of assets that may be needed for purposes of production.

definition: The total resources (output and imports) and uses of goods and services (intermediate consumption, final consumption, gross capital formation and exports). Taxes on products (less subsidies) are also included on the resource side of the accounts.
definition: The total value of goods and services produced within the geographic boundaries of a country for a specified period of time.

zul: Imali yokusebenza eyevile esambeni/imali engenayo eyingxubevange
nso: Thelete ye e alago kgwebong morago ga ditefelo ka
sot: Phaello yohle e sebediswang/lekeno la letswaka
ven: Mufhalalague wa tshumelo / mbuelo yo vanganaho
tso: Nsalo wa mbuyelo hinkwawo/wo pfangana lowu tirhisiwaka
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The balancing item in the generation of income account, i.e. the value added minus compensation of employees payable minus taxes on production payable plus subsidies receivable.

eng: Gross value added at basic prices
afr: Bruto waarde toegevoeg teen basiese pryse
nso: Bolengkakareto go hlakanywa le ditheko ta motheo
sot: Boleng ka kakaretso ka ditheko tsa mantlha
tso: Nkoka hinkwawo lowu engeteriweke ku ya hi mixavo xa xisungusungu
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Output valued at basic prices less intermediate consumption valued at purchasers prices.

eng: Gross value added at producers prices
nso: Boleng kakareto go hlakanywa le ditheko ta motweleti
sot: Boleng ka kakaretso ka ditheko tsa bahlahisi
tsn: Koketsoboleng kakaretso ka ditlhotlhotlhwa tsa montshakuno
tso: Nkoka hinkwawo lowu engeteriweke ku ya hi mixavo ya vumaki
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Output valued at producers prices less intermediate consumption valued at purchasers prices.

nso: Meetse a ka fase ga mabu
sot: Metsi a ka tlase ho lefatshe
tsn: Metsi a a ka fa tlase ga lefatshe
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Fresh water beneath the earths surface (usually in aquifers) supplying wells and springs.

sot: Tlhahiso ya sehlahiswa sa mofuta o le mong
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A unit of homogeneous production is a producer unit in which only a single (non-ancillary) productive activity is carried out.

nso: Tiriophethelela ya nnete ya motse/tiriso ya mafelelo ya nnete ya lapa / Tirionnete ya mafelelo ya lapa
tso: Ntirhiso wo hetelela wa xiheri wa ndyangu
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Household actual final consumption, added to household final consumption expenditure plus the social transfers in kind received from general government and non-profit institutions serving households (NPISH). These refer to social security benefits and social assistance benefits received in kind, and to the individual non-market goods and services provided by government and NPISH.

sot: Ditshenyehelo tsohle tsa disebediswa tsa lelapa
ven: Mbadelo ya tshumisokhunyeledzwa ya zwibviswa zwa mua/haya
tso: Ntirhiso wa nhundzu wo hetelela wa ndyangu
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Includes all consumption expenditure made by households from their own cash resources (including all income in cash received), as well as all the counterpart of income in kind (except social transfers in kind) that households might have received, such as remuneration in kind and other transfers in kind. Note: It also includes the value of all consumption of output for own final use, such as those provided by second homes on own account used for tourism purposes or what it can have received through barter transactions.

nso: Papetotiinywa ya phokotego ya maatla a ditheko
sot: Palo ya kakanyo; tshupane ya kakanyo ya ditheko
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Implied deflators are also known as variable-weighted or Paasche indices (although not strictly of the Paasche type). These price indices are by-products of the deflation procedure, obtained by dividing a series (e.g. value added) expressed at current prices by the corresponding series at constant prices.
definition: Any form of reward the employee received from the employer, for example, salaries and wages or income in any kind such as uniforms, food parcels, etc. (ILO).

definition: Group of establishments engaged in the same or similar kinds of activity. Note: The definition of industry is based on the 1993 SNA and is in line with that contained in the Standard Industrial Classification of All Economic Activities, Fifth Edition; Report No. 09-90-02 of January 1993 (SIC).

sot: Palohare ya phallo ya metsi selemong
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Average annual flow under natural conditions. (This definition is dependent on the runoff regime for each river basin).

definition: A measure of the surplus accruing from processes of production before deducting any explicit or implicit interest charges, rents or other property incomes payable on the financial assets, land or other tangible non-produced assets required to carry on the production. Note: Mixed income is the balancing item in the generation of income account of unincorporated enterprises owned by members of households, either individually or in partnership with others, i.e. the value added minus compensation of employees payable minus taxes on production payable plus subsidies receivable (1993 SNA).

definition: Serves as a framework for statistical systems. It also serves as a point of reference in establishing standards for related statistics. The internationally agreed framework that guides the compilation of national accounts is contained in the SNA (1993 SNA).
definition: Consists mainly of methane occurring naturally in underground deposits. It may be associated with free gas.

sot: Tlhophiso ya diakhaonte tsa mehlodi ya tlhaho
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Accounting system that deals with stocks and stock changes of natural assets, comprising biota (produced or wild), subsoil assets (proved reserves); and water and land with their aquatic and terrestrial ecosystems. It is frequently used in the sense of physical accounting as distinguished from monetary (environmental) accounting.

tsn: Metswedi ya tlholego; metswedi ya tlhago
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Natural assets (raw materials) occurring in nature that can be used for economic production or consumption.

nso: Maaledi a methelo ye mengwe go tweleto
sot: Makgetho a mang a sebele a tlhahiso
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Other taxes on production minus other subsidies on production.

nso: Instituene ya go se dire poelo
tsn: Setheo se e seng sa lotseno
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Legal or social entity created for the purpose of producing goods and services, which is not allowed to be a source of income, profit or other financial gain for the units that establish, control or finance it. Note: These are companies registered under section 21 of the Companies Act.

afr: Instellings sonder winsoogmerk wat huishoudings dien
nso: Dinstituene ta go se dire poelo tsa go hlankela malapa
sot: Diinstithushene tsa tshebeletso ya malapa tse sa etseng phaello
tso: Tindhawu ta nkambhindzulo to korhokela mindyangu
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Non-profit institution which is not predominantly financed and controlled by government and which provides goods or services to households free or at prices that are not economically significant.

nso: Methopo ya thlago ya go se mpshafatege
sot: Mehlodi ya tlhaho e sa kolleng
tsn: Metswedi ya tlholego e e sa nthwafatsegeng
tso: Switirhisiwa swa ntumbuluko leswi nga pfuxetiwiki
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Exhaustible natural resources such as mineral resources (coal or uranium) that cannot be regenerated after exploitation.

nso: Dithuo te dingwe ta dithelete go tweleto
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Subsidies are transfers from the government to the business sector toward current cost of production. These transfers represent additions to the income of producers from current production.

definition: Consist of taxes on the ownership of land, buildings or other assets used in production or on labour employed, etc. Important examples of other taxes on production are taxes on payroll or work force, stamp duties, business or professional licenses, etc.
definition: Goods or services that are produced within an establishment that become available for use outside the establishment, plus any goods and services produced for own final use.

sot: Kadimo ya nakwana bankeng; tjhelete e kadimilweng bankeng
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A type of loan from a bank, used in particular to supply short-term working capital to tide over a production cycle or to finance seasonal requirements.
definition: A portion of a companys profits paid to a shareholder.

nso: GDP go ya ka hlogo/motho ka motho/GDP hlogoka hlogo/ditseno hlogo ka hlogo
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The average production per person of goods and services for the reference period.
definition: The average income per person in a given time period, usually one year.

tso: Vunkota bya swa ntumbuluko na mbangu
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Natural resource and environmental accounting of stocks and changes in stocks in physical (non-monetary) units, for example, weight, area or number. Note: Qualitative measures, expressed in terms of quality classes, types of uses or ecosystem characteristics, may supplement quantitative measures.
definition: Include the agriculture, forestry and fishing, mining and quarrying industries.

sot: Tlhahiso ya motheo; mesebetsi ya sehlooho
ven: Nyito ya ndeme/mushumo wa ndeme /vhuitwa ha ndeme
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The activity whose gross value added exceeds that of any other activity carried out within the same unit.

definition: The amount receivable by the producer from the purchaser for a unit of a good or service produced as output minus any value added tax (VAT), or similar deductible tax, invoiced to the purchaser. It excludes any transport charges invoiced separately by the producer.

definition: A process, carried out under the responsibility, control and management of an institutional unit, in which labour and assets are used to transform inputs of goods and services into outputs of other goods and services. All goods and services produced as outputs must be such that they can be sold on markets, or at least be capable of being provided by one unit to another, with or without charge.

eng: Production account for the total economy
nso: Akhaonte ya tweleto ya ikonomi ka kakareto
sot: Akhaonto ya tlhahiso ya moruo ohle
tso: Nkota ya andziso ya ikhonomi hinkwayo
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The production account is the first in the sequence of accounts compiled for institutional sectors, industries and the total economy. The production account contains three items apart from the balancing item, namely output, intermediate consumption and taxes less subsidies on products. The output is recorded under 'resources' on the right-hand side of the account. Intermediate consumption and taxes less subsidies on products is recorded under 'uses' on the left-hand side of the account.

definition: An economic activity (or production) carried out under the control and responsibility of an institutional unit that uses inputs of labour, capital, and goods and services to produce output of goods and services. Note: The production boundary in the 1993 SNA is more restricted than the general production boundary due to the production accounts not being compiled for household activities that produce domestic or personal services for own final consumption within the same household, except for services produced by paid domestic staff.

definition: The amount paid by the purchaser, excluding any deductible value added tax (VAT) or similar deductible tax, in order to take delivery of a unit of a good or service at the time and place required by the purchaser. The purchasers' price of a good includes any transport charges paid separately by the purchaser to take delivery at the required time and place.

tso: Ntirhiso wa mali wa siku na siku
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Expenditure incurred in the day-to-day running of an organisation or the state in line with its budget.
definition: A region for GDP estimates per region is defined as a province.
definition: See GDP per region.
definition: Sums set aside out of the profits of a company that are not distributed as dividends. They are created for the purpose of meeting future capital needs of the company.
definition: Increase or decrease in the value of a currency or of fixed assets, typically freehold land and buildings.

definition: Revision of the estimates for all components of the national accounts is usually done every five years in conjunction with the rebasing of the estimates at constant prices apart from the revision of estimates for the latest quarters. At such a time, the results of censuses that have become available in the meantime and any other additional information sources are incorporated in the estimates.
definition: See Social Accounting Matrix.

sot: Tokisetso ya dihla; ditlhophisetso tsa dinako tsa selemo
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A statistical technique to remove the effects of seasonal calendar influences operating on a series.
definition: An activity carried out within a single establishment in addition to the principal activity.

nso: Diintaseteri ta tlaleleto legatong la bobedi
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The secondary industries include the manufacturing, electricity, water and construction industries.
definition: See System of Environmental and Economic Accounting.

sot: Sehokanyi sa tlhophiso ya diakhaonte tsa setjhaba
tsn: Lenaneopalotlotloloago; palotlotlo ya loago ya materisi
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Presentation of an SNA account in a matrix form, which elaborates on the linkages between SU-tables and institutional sectors accounts (1993 SNA).

tsn: Lenaneo la sekwere; materisi wa sekwere
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A matrix is square when it has an equal number of columns and rows.
definition: Subsidies on products are payable per unit of a good or service.
definition: Are sometimes referred to as rectangular input-output tables, make and use tables, supply and disposition of commodities tables.
definition: table that gives information about the resources of goods and services.
definition: See Supply and use tables.
definition: Symmetric tables use similar classifications or units, i.e. same groups of products for both the rows and the columns.

eng: System of Environmental and Economic Accounting
afr: Stelsel van Omgewings- en Ekonomiese Boekhouding
nso: Mokgwatiriano wa diakhaonte ta ikonomi le tikologo
sot: Tlhophiso ya diakhaonte tsa tikoloho le moruo
tsn: Thulaganyo ya Palotlotlo ya Tikologo le Ikonomi
ven: Sisieme ya mbalelano ya mupo na ekonomi
tso: Sisiteme ya vunkota bya mbangu na bya ikhonomi
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: A satellite system to the System of category: National Accounts (SNA) developed by the United Nations Statistical Division, for the incorporation of environmental concerns (environmental costs, benefits and assets) in the national accounts. The SEEA is intended to be a system with global application and standards, suitable for all countries and all aspects of the environment.
An internationally agreed standard system for macro-economic accounts. Note: The latest version is described in the 1993 System of category: National Accounts (1993 SNA).

definition: Consist of taxes on incomes, profits and capital gains. Note: They are assessed on the actual or presumed incomes of individuals, households, non-profit institutions serving households (NPISHs) or corporations. They include taxes assessed on holdings of property, land or real estate when these holdings are used as a basis for estimating the income of their owners.

xho: Iirhafu zemveliso nakwimpahla evela ngaphandle kwemida yeli
zul: Izintela emkhiqizweni nasezimpahleni ezivela kwamanye amazwe
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Taxes which add to the cost of production and are likely to be reflected in market prices paid by the purchaser, such as sales and excise taxes, import duties and property taxes. Taxes on production and imports include taxes on products and tourism.

definition: Taxes payable on goods and services when they are produced, delivered, sold or otherwise disposed of by their producers. Furthermore, they are payable per unit of a good or service produced. Important examples of tourism are excise and import duties and value added tax (VAT).

nso: Diintaseteri ta tlaleleto legatong la boraro
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Include wholesale, retail and motor trade; catering and accommodation, transport, storage and communication, finance, real estate and business services, community, social and personal services, general government services, and other producers.
definition: A transaction in which one institutional unit provides goods, service or assets to another unit without receiving from the latter any goods, service or assets in return as counterpart.

nso: Thutio ya go se be ya thelete
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The transfer of the ownership of a good or an asset, other than cash, or the provision of a service.
definition: A short-term obligation that is not interest-bearing because it is purchased at a discount from the South African Reserve Bank and can be traded on a discount basis for 91 days.

tso: Tafula ra ntirhiso ra swa vupfhumba
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A table that gives information on the uses of goods and services, and also on cost structures of the industries.
definition: The difference between the value of goods and services produced and the value of the intermediate goods and services consumed in the course of production.

nso: Boleng bjo bo tlaleleditwego ke intaseteri
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Value added measures the value created by production and may be calculated either before or after deducting the consumption of fixed capital on the fixed assets used. Gross value added is defined as the value of output less the value of intermediate consumption. Value added is the balancing item in the production account for an institutional unit or sector, or establishment or industry.

nso: Dikarolwana ta boleng bjo bo tlaleleditwego
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The use table distinguishes three different components of value added, i.e. compensation of employees, other taxes less subsidies on production, and gross operating surplus/mixed income.
definition: An area defined for specific water management purposes.

sot: Kabo ka teko ya asiti; tlhahlobo ya botsitso/tekanyo
ven: Ndivhanele ya ndingo yo khwahaho ya esidi
eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info:
definition: The acid test ratio is calculated as current assets minus inventory divided by current liabilities.
Note: The accepted acid test ratio is considered to be 1:1; in other words, the institution is able to meet its current credit obligations without disposing of its inventory.

zul: Ukuthengwa kwempahla engasetshenziswa isikhathi esingaphezu konyaka
nso: Khweto ya dithoto te di sa uthego/ ta go se uthe
tso: Nkumo wa nhundzu ya nkarhi wo leha
eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The aggregate capital statement (or acquisition of fixed assets statement) shows the total capital expenditure incurred by each service during the year. Details of purchases and sales of assets are reflected in the aggregate capital statement, but appear in the consolidated balance sheet as a single amount (normally the item in the consolidated balance sheet is referred to as fixed assets).

zul: Isamba sezindleko zokuthengwa kwempahla engasetshenziswa isikhathi esingaphezu konyaka
nso: Tshenyagalelomoka ya dithoto/ tshenyagalelokakareto ya dithoto
eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Total capital expenditure incurred by each service during the year.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A statement of the financial position reflecting all assets and liabilities.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Interest paid on redemption payments for loaned funds.

zul: Izindleko zokuthengwa kwempahla engasetshenziswa isikhathi esingaphezu konyaka
eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Any expenditure incurred or incidental to the acquisition or improvement of land, buildings, engineering structures and machinery and equipment. Note: The expenditure normally confers a lasting benefit and results in the acquisition of, or extends the life of a fixed or long-term work, irrespective of whether payments were made to outside contractors or concerns, or the work was done by the enterprise itself. Capital expenditure includes vehicles, office furniture and equipment, but excludes minor items that are generally regarded as being expendable even though in some instances their useful lives may extend beyond one year.

zul: Izindleko zokuthengwa kwempahla entsha engasetshenziswa isikhathi esingaphezu konyaka
tso: Ntirhiso wa nhundzu eka rifuwo lerintshwa
eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Capital expenditure on new assets includes: The erection of new buildings and works, additions to and alterations of existing buildings and works; Capital work in progress capitalised; New plant and machinery, vehicles and equipment; and Used plant and machinery, which was imported by or on behalf of the enterprise whether paid to outside contractors/ concerns, or which was done by the enterprise itself.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Transactions, either in cash or in kind, in which the ownership of an asset (other than cash and inventories) is transferred from one institutional unit to another, or in which cash is transferred to enable the recipient to acquire another asset, or in which the funds realised by the disposal of another asset are transferred.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Services provided collectively to the community, particularly applicable to services such as general administration, public order or safety and economic services.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The total remuneration, in cash or kind, payable by an employer to an employee in return for work done by the latter during the accounting period. Note: It is recorded on a gross basis, i.e. before any deduction for income taxes, pensions, unemployment insurance and other social insurance schemes. It also includes other forms of compensation, namely commissions, tips, bonuses, directors fees and allowances such as those for holidays and sick leave, as well as military pay and allowances. It excludes employers social contributions.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: Financial Statistics / category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Assets including debtors, cash, other financial shares and closing values of inventories, likely to be converted to cash, or consumed within a year.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A measure of the ability of an entity to meet its short-term obligations using the most liquid short-term assets; current assets divided by current liabilities.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info:
definition: Long-term securities that give owners the unconditional right to fixed money income or contractually determined variable money incomes, normally referred to as interest.
Note: Most debentures also give owners the unconditional right to a fixed sum(s) as repayment of principal on a specified date(s).

sot: Ditjeo tsa sesebediswa; ho theoha ha boleng ba sesebediswa
eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info:
definition: The systematic allocation of the cost of an asset over its useful life.
Note: The amounts in the column for depreciation represent amounts written off on assets by extra-budgetary accounts and funds and universities and technikons. The accounts of national and provincial governments are kept on a cash basis. No provision is made for depreciation in the accounts of municipalities.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Municipality that has a municipal executive and legislative authority in an area that includes more than one municipality, and which is described in section 155(1) of the Constitution as a category C municipality.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A freestanding, complete structure on a separate stand or a self-contained dwelling unit, granny flat, outbuildings and garages, on the same premises as an existing residence.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A measure of the nature and economic effect of government operations on the economy of the country.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Consumption, which includes all cash expenditure on goods and services, incurred by the household, business, government, etc. for consumption purposes. It also includes imputed value for own produced items consumed.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Accounts and funds of national and provincial governments not included in normal budget totals and which do not operate through normal budgetary procedures, e.g. trading accounts and general government accounts.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Unit primarily engaged in both incurring liabilities and acquiring financial assets in the market. Note: Financial institutions may be entirely or mainly owned and/or controlled by government in which case they are regarded as public financial institutions. It is the prime function of financial institutions to act as intermediaries.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Classification of expenditure according to the purpose for which transactions are undertaken. It is generally used to measure the allocation of resources by government in order to promote various services and objectives rendered to the community.

eng: General expenditure {definition: All amounts of money paid out by a government during its fiscal year net of recoveries and other correcting transactions other than for retirement of debt, purchase of investment securities, extension of loans, and agency or private trust transactions. Note: Under this definition, expenditure relates to external payments of a government and excludes amounts transferred to funds or agencies of the same government (other than payments to intragovernmental service funds.}
eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info:
definition: Government units whose primary activity is to assume responsibility for the provision of goods and services to the community or to individual households free of charge or at prices that are not economically significant and to redistribute income and wealth by means of transfers.
Note: A defining characteristic of general government is the ability to impose, directly or indirectly, taxes and other compulsory levies for which there is no direct quid pro quo on other sectors of the economy.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Housing services include approved housing projects and can be subdivided in respect of various economic, subeconomic, complexes or other types of housing. Where dwellings form part of the general organisation of a particular department, and are normally occupied by employees of the department, they are included in the relative statement and not under housing services. Likewise, where properties are purchased for a specific purpose, such as a street widening, and existing houses are demolished; the annual expenditure and income in respect of these dwellings do not appear in the housing service. See individual services.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Community and social services, such as education, health and welfare, rendered to- individuals or a small group of persons. See housing services.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Physical structures used for the delivery of services (e.g. power lines, pipes, roads and assets such as trucks and equipment to unblock sewerage, pay-point offices and computers).

eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A process by which municipalities prepare 5-year strategic plans that are reviewed annually in consultation with communities and stakeholders.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Loans to any fund or account within the local government institution are treated as internal loans. Total internal interest received and/or capitalised must correspond with the total internal interest paid. Also see note above for capital charges.

nso: Dipeeleto ka go dithireleto ta go bapatega/rekiega
tsn: Peeletso mo dithotong tse di bapatsegang
eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Investment in marketable securities includes: Own stock; Stocks of other local government institutions; Government stock and treasury bills; Public corporation stock; and Investment in non-marketable instruments.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Money or securities supplied by one party (the lender) to a second party (the borrower) in a transaction in return for a promised future payment, including payment of interest as per agreed repayment schedules, by the borrower.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: An approach towards economic development which allows and encourages local people to work together to achieve sustainable economic growth and development thereby bringing economic benefits and improved quality of life for all residents in a local municipal area.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Municipality that shares a municipal executive and legislative authority in its area with a district municipality within whose area it falls as described in section 155(1) of the Constitution as a category B municipality.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Local government institutions include: District municipalities; Metropolitan municipalities; and Local municipalities.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Municipality that shares a municipal executive and legislative authority in its area with a district municipality within whose area it falls described in section 155(1) of the Constitution as a category B municipality.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A loan with an outstanding maturity of one year or longer.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Machinery and equipment include motor vehicles, ships, aircraft, equipment and furniture. Military expenditure on machinery and equipment which could be used for civilian purposes is included.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: For the purpose of this survey, managerial positions refer to section 57 managers, according to the Local Government: Municipal Systems Act, 2000 (Act No. 32 of 20 November 2000) and other managers according to the organogram.

nso: Dithoto ta kadimo ta go bapatega/rekiega
eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Stocks, debentures and similar debt instruments that are freely marketable, i.e. securities for which transfer registers are kept and which are usually listed on the stock exchange. Discounts originating with the issue of stocks below par are included in the stock liability.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Expenditure on maintenance included in remuneration of employees and/or other goods and services and can be found in Table 2 in the columns for memorandum items.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Municipality that has a municipal executive and legislative authority in an area that includes more than one Municipality, as described in section 155(1) of the Constitution as a category A municipality.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Instruments such as bankers acceptance, trade bills, promissory notes, capital project bills, bridging debentures, negotiable certificates of deposits, Land Bank bills, Land Bank and the South African Reserve Banks debentures.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: Financial Statistics / category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The area of jurisdiction of the third sphere of government, after national and provincial.

nso: Kgwebo ya mmuo ya go aba ditirelo fela sethabeng
sot: Kgwebo ya setjhaba eo eseng ya ditjhelete
ven: Tshiimiswa tsha muvhuso tshayambuelo tsha u etshedza tshumelo
tso: Mabindzunyingi ya mfumo ya vukorhokeri bya vanhu
eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A government-owned and/or -controlled unit which sells industrial or commercial goods and services to the public on a large scale.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Other expenditure includes payments by district municipalities to national and provincial government and other local government institutions for development aid.

xho: Abanye oomatshini nezinye izixhobo ezisetyenziswa eburhulumenteni
eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Machinery and equipment not included as vehicles, computer equipment, computer software and office furniture.

ven: Tshanduko kha ana / tshanduko ya phesenthe
eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The change in an index (or other series) from one period to another expressed as a percentage of its value in the first of the two periods.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Any amount set aside for the purpose of meeting either specific requirements where the amounts thereof can be closely estimated, and specific commitments; or known contingencies and diminutions in values of assets existing as at the date of the balance sheet, where the amounts involved cannot be determined with significant accuracy. Including bad debts, repairs and maintenance, and lossof rent.

ven: Zwiimiswa zwa masheleni/tshelede zwa nnyi na nnyi muvhuso
eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Units primarily engaged in both incurring liabilities and acquiring financial assets in the market. Note: Financial institutions may be entirely or mainly owned and/or controlled by the government in which case they are regarded as public financial institutions. It is the prime function of public financial institutions to act as intermediaries.

eng: Quarterly percentage change between a specific quarter of the previous year and the same quarter of the current year
afr: Kwartaallikse persentasieverandering tussen n spesifieke kwartaal van die vorige jaar en die ooreenstemmende kwartaal van die huidige jaar
nbl: Itjhuguluko lamaphesente ngekota hlangana kwekota ethileko yanyakenye nekota efanako yanonyaka
xho: Ipesenti yekota etshintsha phakathi kwekota ethile yonyaka odlulileyo naleyo yonyaka omiyo
zul: Ukuguquka ngokwamaphesenti ngokwamakwata ngokuqhathanisa ikwata elithile lonyaka odlule nekwata elifanayo lanonyaka
nso: Phetogo ya phesente magareng ga kotara ye e itego ya ngwagola le kotara ya go swana nayo ya lenyagas/ngwaga wo
sot: Phesente ya phetoho ya kotara e ikgethileng ya selemo se fetileng papisong le ya selemo sena
tsn: Phetogo ya phesente ka kotaramagareng ga kotara e e kgethegileng ya ngogola le kotara e e tshwanang ya monongwaga
ssw: Kuntjintja kwemaphesenti ngekotatsite yemnyaka lowengcile kanye naleyo kota yalomnyaka
ven: Tshanduko kha ana nga kotara vhukati ha kotaratiwa ya mahoa na ya waha uno wa muvhalelano
tso: Ncinco wa tiphesente hi kotara exikarhi ka kotara yo karhi ya lembe leri hundzeke na kotara yoleyo ya lembe leri
eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Quarterly percentage change between the previous year and the current year for the same quarter refers to the comparison of the three months of the current quarter in the current year with that of the similar period of the previous year. The amounts shown for each quarter are not cumulative.

eng: Quarterly percentage change between the previous year and the current year for the same quarter
afr: Kwartaallikse persentasieverandering tussen die ooreenstemmende kwartaal van die vorige jaar en die huidige jaar
nbl: Itjhuguluko lamaphesente ngekota hlangana kwanyakenye nanon yaka ngekota efanako
xho: Ipesenti yekota etshintsha phakathi komnyaka odluleyo nalowo umi leyo ngokwekota leyo
zul: Ukuguquka kwephesenti ngokwamakwata ngokuqhathanisa unyaka odlule nekwata elifanayo lanonyaka
nso: Phetogo ya phesente magareng ga kotara ye e itego ya ngwagola le kotara ya go swana nayo ya lenyaga/ngwaga wo
sot: Phesente ya phetoho ya kotara ya selemo se fetileng papisong le ya selemo sena
tsn: Phetogo ya phesente ka kotara magareng ga ngogola le kotara e e tshwanang ya monongwaga
ssw: Kuntjintja kwemaphesenti ngekota yemnyaka lophelile kanye nekota yalomnyaka
ven: Tshanduko kha ana vhukati ha mahoa na awaha kha kotara nthihi
tso: Ncinco wa tiphesente hi kotara exikarhi ka lembe leri hundzeke na lembe leri eka kotara yo fana
eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The comparison of the three months of the current quarter in the current year with that of the similar period of the previous year. The amounts shown for each quarter are not cumulative.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: remuneration / category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The change in the remuneration of employees (or turnover of institutions) of the given quarter compared with the remuneration of employees (or turnover of institutions) of the previous quarter expressed as a percentage.

tso: Tihakelo ta ndhawu na vukorkokeri byo angarhela
eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Municipal services that are not economically self-supporting and are financed by imposing assessment and other rates, the receipt of subsidies and other contributions. This includes ambulance services, fire control (or fire-fighting), health services (clinics, old-age homes), roads and storm water drainage, parks and recreation (libraries, cultural activities, museums, sport administration, community halls, swimming pools, sports grounds, nature reserves, etc.), sewerage and cleansing, traffic (licensing offices) and other services (city engineers, administration, personnel, legal services, city treasurer, etc.). See trading services.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: survey / category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Reference quarter for the survey refers to the three months up to the end of each quarter.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: All construction work not included under new construction. Such repairs may be broken down into capital repairs and current repairs and maintenance.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Include all expenditure on repairs and maintenance of the various assets of the department or service. Where considered necessary, the cost of repairs in respect of the various types of assets, e.g. buildings, plant, may be subdivided. Where repairs and maintenance have been charged to a provision for repairs account, the actual expenditure incurred during the current year has been reflected under this subdivision and the amount chargeable to the provision for repairs is reflected as a deduction from the actual cost. Any balance of expenditure still remaining is treated as a charge against the current year.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Amounts set aside out of surpluses, which are not designed to meet any liability, contingency, commitment or diminution in the value of assets known to exist as at the date of the balance sheet. An example of a reserve would be the tariff stabilisation reserve.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Buildings that are used primarily as residences. Inclusions: Dwelling houses; flats; holiday chalets; hostels; houses; institutions for the disabled; motels; nursing homes; old-age homes; and townhouses.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Salaries and wages include payments to full-time and part-time employees irrespective of whether the remuneration is paid from revenue, capital or any other account or fund.
