Salaries, wages and allowances include: Salaries and wages; Allowances; Contributions to other benefit funds of employees such as medical aid, group life, etc. (excluding unemployment insurance and workmens compensation); Other benefits, e.g. housing loan subsidy; Pension fund contributions; Quarters, rations and other expenditure (accommodation, food, medical expenditure, etc., whether provided in cash or in kind); and Uniform clothing and allowances (clothing, boots, overalls, etc., supplied to uniformed employees).

eng_pos_or_descriptor: manufacturing / category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Sales are the total value of sales and transfers-out of all own manufactured products/articles and the amounts received for installation, erection or assembly or other services rendered.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: mining / category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Sales are the total value of sales and transfers-out of goods mined by the mining establishments and the amounts received for installation, erection or assembly or other services rendered.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Include loans from: Local authorities loans fund; Local government institutions; Development Bank of Southern Africa; Public corporations; Banks; Insurers; Pension funds; Other domestic sources; and Foreign sources.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Governments expenditure obligations that do not require a vote or statutory provisions, including contractual guarantee commitments and international agreements.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Amounts appropriated to be spent in terms of statutes and not requiring appropriation by vote.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Current unrequited payments that government units pay to enterprises to assist or encourage them, on the basis of the quantities or values of the goods and services that they produce, sell or import.

nso: Dithuo ta dithelete go tweleto/ disapositi go tweleto
eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Payments made to resident enterprises as a consequence of engaging in production.

nso: Dithuo ta dithelete go ditweletwa/ disapositi go ditweletwa
eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Payments made per unit of good or service.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Sundry debtors include: personal housing loans, other housing loans: mortgages, selling agreements, hire purchases and sponsored government housing loans to welfare.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Municipal services for which the tariffs are determined in such a way that the provision of the service should yield a trading profit; market-related goods and services. See rates and general services.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: local authority / category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Funds which form part of the local authoritys money and which may have been donated or bequeathed to it for a specific use under its sole control. This amount is reflected in the consolidated balance sheet.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Expenditure that cannot be allocated to a specific function.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: An appropriation voted by national or provincial government. See statutory appropriation.

nso: Thulaganyo ya tlhabollo ya ditirelo ta meetse
sot: Moralo wa ntshetsopele ditshebeletsong tsa metsi
ven: Nzudzanyo ya mveledziso ya tshumelo ya mai
tso: Pulani ya nhluvukiso wa vukorhokeri bya mati
eng_pos_or_descriptor: category: National, Provincial and Local Government
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The WSDP is a sectoral plan that falls within the inter-sectoral umbrella plan of the IDP.

definition: The total process of collecting, processing, analyzing and publishing or otherwise disseminating demographic, economic and social data pertaining to all persons in a country or a well-defined part of a country at a specified time.

nso: Mosebegae letating la go bala batho
tsn: Tokololo ya lelapa e e seng teng
ven: Murao u siho wa mua / haya
tso: Xirho xa muti lexi nga riki kona
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A member of a household who was not present at the time of the interview. See absent household member (reference night).

nso: Mosebegae boegong bja palo ya batho
tsn: Tokololo ya lelapa e e seng teng
tso: Xirho xa muti lexi nga riki kona
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A person who is usually part of the household but was not present in the dwelling on census night. See absent household member (interview).
definition: The date officially proclaimed by the government for the population census.

definition: The day of the population census date. This is the reference day for persons who were away from home during census night for work, entertainment or travel, but returned home the following day without being counted elsewhere.
definition: The night before the census day. The decisive point of time for being included in the census or not is set as midnight on that night.

eng: Census phases {definition: The three main phases of a census are: 1) the pre-enumeration phase for all planning of the census; 2) the enumeration phase for execution of fieldwork; and 3) the post-enumeration phase for data processing, analysis and dissemination of census results.}

nso: Mmalobatho wo o theilwago boegong bja mmalobatho/palobatho
sot: Palo ya setjhaba ho latela moo motho a leng teng
tsn: Palobatho go ya ka kwa ba leng teng
tso: Nhlayelo wa vanhu ku ya hi laha va kumekaka kona
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A census in which people are enumerated according to where they stay on census night.

zul: Ukubalwa kwabantu lapho bevame ukuhlala khona
nso: Palobatho/mmalobatho wo o theilwego bodulong bja tlwaelo
sot: Palo ya setjhaba ho latela moo motho a phelang teng
tsn: Palobatho go ya ka bonno ba ka gale
tso: Nhlayelo wa vanhu ku ya hi laha vanhu va tshamaka kona
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A census in which people are enumerated according to where they usually live.

tsn: Modiredi wa mo gae yo o robalang
tso: Mutirhi wa le kaya, loyi a tshamaka entirhweni
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A domestic worker who lives on the property of the employer, either in the same house or in separate domestic quarters. See domestic worker under labour.
definition: The process of counting all the members of a given population and collecting demographic and other information about each person. See direct interview and self-enumeration.
definition: The proclaimed period within which enumeration should be conducted.

definition: The stage of the population census process that involves counting the people. During this phase, enumerators visit every household and all collective living quarters to administer questionnaires. See census phases.
definition: A person who visits households or individuals in a specific enumeration area for the purpose of administration of questionnaires or for self-enumeration.

tso: Buku ya nkatsakanyo wa muhlayeri wa vanhu
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A register of demarcation and listing information pertaining to a particular EA, known colloquially as the 09 book, which identifies an EA by province, local authority, main place name and subplace name, and by means of maps and/or aerial photographs. Used during enumeration to record key information such as visits or attempted visits, and total households and people counted.
definition: An office or other place from where fieldwork is controlled. At the fieldwork station the boxes of questionnaires are distributed, collected, checked and registered.
definition: A group of persons who live together and provide themselves jointly with food and/or other essentials for living, or a single person who lives alone.
definition: The main decision-maker, or the person who owns or rents the dwelling, or the person who is the main breadwinner.
definition: Any member of the household acting on behalf of the head of the household.
definition: Compare household income (household income and expenditure).
definition: Loss or deviation of physiological, neurological or anatomical structure or function of an organ or body part. See handicap.
definition: A person who was living in the household at the time of the post-enumeration survey but was not living in the household at the time of the census.

sot: Mosebetsi wa lelapa ya dulang moo
tsn: Modiredi wa mo gae yo o robalang
tso: Mutirhi wa le kaya loyi a tshamaka entirhweni
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: See domestic worker, live-in.
definition: An operation whereby households and individuals enumerated during a census and a post-enumeration survey are compared for similarities and differences.
definition: A situation where data collection is incomplete as the enumerator fails to make contact with a household at an address, or an individual in collective living quarters.
definition: A person who was living in the household at the time of the census and at the time of the post-enumeration survey.
definition: A person who was living in the household at the time of the census but was not living in the household at the time of the post-enumeration survey.
definition: The number of persons or households inadvertently counted twice in a census.
definition: See post-enumeration survey.
definition: For persons born in South Africa, the province where the person was born, according to the present geography. For foreign-born persons, the country where the person was born.
definition: The place where the person was on census night (in a de facto census), whether or not this is his/her usual place of residence.

nso: Lefelo la bodulo la tlwaelo/la ka mehla
tso: Ndhawu laha munhu a talaka ku tshama kona
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The geographical place where the person resides four nights a week on average. Usually collected at subplace level.
definition: A survey conducted on the whole population.

nso: Legato la ka morago ga palobatho/mmalobatho
tso: Nkarhi endzhaku ka nhlayelo wa vanhu
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The stage of the census after all questionnaires have been administered and collected.

nso: Tekolo ya ka morago ga palobatho/tekolo ya ka morago ga mmalobatho
tso: Mbalango endzhaku ka nhlayelo wa vanhu
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A sample survey conducted immediately after the census to evaluate the census. Adjustments for undercount or overcount are then made to the census results based on the results of the PES.

nso: Legato la pele ga palobatho/legato la pele ga mmalobatho
tso: Nkarhi wo rhangela nhlayelo wa vanhu
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The stage of the census during which all preparatory work is carried out.

eng: Relationship to the head or acting head of the household
afr: Verwantskap met huishoudingshoof of waarnemende huishoudingshoof
nbl: Ubuhlobo nehloko yomuzi namkha nomjaphethe wehloko yomuzi
xho: Ubudlelwane nentloko yomzi okanye nebambela-ntloko yomzi
nso: Kamano le hlogo goba moswarelahlogo wa lapa
sot: Dikamano le hlooho kapa motshwaredi wa hlooho ya lelapa
ven: Vhushaka kha hoho kana hohopfareli ya mua / haya
tso: Vuxaka exikarhi ka muhlayiwa na nhloko ya ndyangu kumbe mukhomeri wa nhloko ya ndyangu
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Relationship through blood, marriage, adoption or other circumstance.
definition: A case, of a person, household or a questionnaire, where matching between the census and the post-enumeration survey is successful.
definition: The number of people or households that were not counted in the census.

definition: A case, of a person, household or questionnaire, where matching between the census and the post-enumeration survey fails because of a lack of adequate information or because responses differ.
definition: That level of the standard of living measure below which a household is unable to meet its basic needs.

definition: Measure of the degree of inequality among the poor.
Note: The DPI is considered conventional and measures the incidence of poverty and the degree of inequality among the poor using an aversion parameter and determines the proportionate decrease from the poverty line. It also shows the living standards and relates them to the population at large.
definition: Measure that considers the degree of poverty and the extent to which expenditure of the poor lies below the poverty line.

definition: Index that shows how close a given distribution of income is to absolute equality or inequality.
Note: The Gini coefficient is the ratio of the area between the 45-degree line and the Lorenz curve and the area of the entire triangle. As the coefficient approaches zero, the distribution of income or consumption approaches absolute equality, and absolute inequality if it approaches 1.

sot: Karolo ya mafutsana setjhabeng; palo ya motho ka mong
ven: Ndivhanele ya muthu nga muthu ya vhushai
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The percentage or proportion of persons taken to be poor, in relation to the total population in a given country, region, etc. In other words, it is the proportion of the population whose standard of living is lower than the country-specific poverty line (usually measured in terms of income or consumption).

nso: Minimamo ya maemo a bophelo a a amogelegago
sot: Maemo a tlase a amohelehang a bophelo
tsn: Maemotlase a a amogelesegang a botshelo
tso: Mahanyelo ya vutomi lama amukelekaka ya le hansi
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The ability for an individual or household to meet their basic needs, namely minimum accommodation, water, food, health care, education and sanitation.
definition: The difference between the poverty line and mean income of the poor, expressed as a ratio of the poverty line.

sot: Tshupo ya sekgeo sa bofutsana; tshupane ya sekgeo sa bofutsana
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info:
definition: The proportion by which an individual or a household is below the poverty line.
Note: The poverty gap multiplied by the headcount index, gives the poverty gap index.

definition: Line drawn at a particular level of income or consumption. Households/individuals whose incomes fall below a given level of the poverty line or whose consumption level is valued at less than the value of the poverty line are classified as poor. See relative poverty line and absolute poverty line.

definition: A description of how the extent of poverty varies across subgroups of a given population, characterised by, for example, their gender, region of residence, type of economic activity, source of income, etc.
definition: Country-specific indicators that, taken together, provide an overview of the state of poverty in that country.
definition: The position of an individual or household compared with the average income in a given country.

sot: Moedi wa bofutsana bo amanngwang le naha
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Under the relative poverty line approach, a household can be defined as poor relative to others in the same society or economy. Thus a relative poverty line varies as the average of total population consumption varies. It involves drawing an arbitrary line by identifying the proportions (such as mean, median, or even a fraction of the mean) and establishing a poverty line(s) from expenditure or income data. See poverty line.

definition: The price of a product, which is set consciously by an individual producer or group of producers, and/or any price which can be determined or influenced by government, either directly, or through one or other government agencies/institutions without reference to market forces.

nso: Kelo ya kgolo le theogo ya ditheko/kelo ya kgolo le theogo ya infoleiene
sot: Sekgahla sa phetoho ya ditheko ka selemo; infleishini
ven: Phimo ya tshanduko ya mitengo ya waha
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The change in the CPI for all items of the relevant month of the current year compared with the CPI for all items of the same month in the previous year expressed as a percentage.
definition: The change in the index of the relevant month of the current year compared with the index of the same month in the previous year expressed as a percentage.

zul: Isilinganisomvama/ i-avareji yezinga lokukhuphuka kwamandla emali ngonyaka
nso: Kelokakareo ya kgolo le phokotego/infoleiene ka ngwaga
sot: Palohare ya sekgahla sa infleishini ka selemo
tsn: Palogare ya kelo ya phetogotlhotlhwa ka ngwaga
ven: Phimotshikati kha tshanduko ya mitengo nga waha
tso: Mpimo wa inifulexini wa lembe wa mpimoxikarhi
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The change in the average CPI for all items of one year compared with the average CPI for all items of the previous year expressed as a percentage.

sot: Palohare ya phetoho ya phesente ka selemo
tsn: Phetogo ya palogare ya phesente ka ngwaga
tso: Ncinco wa tiphesente ta lembe wa mpimoxikarhi
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The change in the average index of one year compared with the average index of the previous year expressed as a percentage.
definition: A valuation concept expressed at the prices prevailing during a fixed reference period or base period.
definition: An index that measures the price of a fixed basket of consumer goods and services.

eng: Consumer price index excluding interest rates on mortgage bonds {definition: The CPI excluding interest rates on mortgage bonds is derived by excluding the interest rates on mortgage bonds from the basket of goods and services, which is used to compile the Consumer Price Index.}
nbl: Ikomba yetjhugulukontengo yabathengi enganabhondi / enganamalinzalo yebhondi
xho: Isalathiso sotshintsho lwamaxabiso kungabandakanywa inzala yentengo yezindlu
zul: Inkomba yamanani abathengi ingabalwanga inzalo yezikweletu zezindlu
nso: Kelothupeto ya ditheko ta badirii go sa akaretwe mothelo wa tswalo go dikoloto ta meago
sot: Tshupane ya ditheko tsa bareki ntle le tswala ditefellong tsa matlo
tsn: Tshupane ya ditlhotlhwa tsa badirisi ntle le kelomorokotso mo tshireletsodisugeng
ssw: Inkhomba luntjintjo lwentsengo yebatsengi kukhishwe lizinga lentalo kumabhondi esibambiso
ven: Tshikala- / tsumbamutengo wa vharengi tshayaphimonzwalelo kha khadzimiso ya vhudzulo
tso: Xikombo xa nxavo wa vatirhisi lexi nga katsiki mpimo wa ntswalo wa tihakelo eka tibondo
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The CPI excluding interest rates on mortgage bonds (CPIX) is derived by excluding the interest rates on mortgage bonds from the basket of goods and services, which is used to compile the Consumer Price Index.

eng: Contribution of specific products to the total PPI
afr: Bydraes van spesifieke produkte tot die totale VPI
nbl: Umthelela wemikhiqizo ethileko ye-PPI ikomba yetjhugulukontengo yokukhiqiza / yokuveza)
zul: Iqhaza lemikhiqizo ethile esambeni senkomba yamanani abakhiqizi
nso: Seabe sa ditweletwa te itego go PPI ka moka
sot: Seabo sa dihlahiswa tse itseng ho PPI yohle
tsn: Seabe sa dikuno tse di totilweng go TDB yotlhe
ven: Thikhedzo ya zwibveledzwatiwa kha hanganyelo ya tsumbamutengo / tshikalamutengo wa vhabveledzi
tso: Ku hoxa xandla ka swimakiwa swo kongoma eka PPI hinkwayo
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The monthly (annual) contribution of a specific product or group of products to the total PPI is calculated by multiplying the weight of the index with the monthly (annual) change of the index divided by the index for All Items.

nbl: Ikomba yetjhugulukontengo khulu / mbala/ qobo / qakathekileko/ eyonayona/ ezijameleko
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: The core index is derived by exclusions from the CPI on the basis that changes in their prices are policy. Note: Exclusions from the CPI to obtain the core index, and the reasons for exclusion is as follows: Fresh and frozen meat and fish: category: Prices may be highly volatile, particularly during and following periods of drought. Fresh and frozen vegetables and fresh fruit and nuts: category: Prices may be highly volatile from month to month due to their sensitivity to climatic conditions. Interest rates on mortgage bonds and overdrafts/personal loans: These are excluded due to their perverse effect on the CPI. A tightening in monetary policy to counter inflation pressures would cause interest rates to rise and be reflected in the interest cost component of measured inflation. This, in turn, could provoke a further tightening of monetary policy resulting in excessive movements in the inflation rate. Changes in VAT (value added tax): VAT is predominantly determined by government (fiscal policy). Assessment rates: These taxes are predominantly determined by local government.

nso: Kelo ya kgolo le phokotego/infoleiene ya motheo
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A measure designed in relation to the specific structure of a country's economy, derived by the change in the Core index of the relevant month of the current year compared with the Core index of the same month in the previous year expressed as a percentage.
definition: See consumer price index.
definition: See consumer price index excluding interest rates on mortgage bonds.
definition: The smallest economic unit that functions as a separate entity.
definition: Products whose sale value represents 80% of the total value of sales (turnover) in an industrial subgroup.

definition: The persistent change in the general level of prices. Note: Two sets of measures of inflation are most often used, namely monthly inflation and annual inflation. Monthly inflation is defined as the percentage change in the index on a month-by-month basis whereas annual inflation is calculated as the percentage change in the index over the last twelve months.

nso: Kelo ya kgolo le theogo ya ditheko/kelo ya kgolo le theogo ya infoleiene
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The annual percentage change in the CPI for all items of the relevant month of the current year compared with the CPI for all items of the same month in the previous year expressed as a percentage.
definition: The change in the index of the relevant month compared to the index of the previous month expressed as a percentage.

sot: Palohare e akaretsang ya phesente ya phetoho ya selemong
tsn: Phetogo ya palogareyotlhe ya phesente ka ngwaga
tso: Ncinco wa tiphesente wa lembe wa mpimoxikarhi hinkwawo
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The change in the average index of one year compared with the average index of the previous year expressed as a percentage.

definition: Administered prices that are monitored and controlled by government policy.
Note: To this end, price regulation does not necessarily imply the presence of an economic regulator, but the restriction on the extent to which prices may vary, depending on governments policy objective.

definition: The relevant importance of the indicator product in that subgroup. Note: The weight of a product is calculated by dividing the actual value of sales of the relevant indicator product by the total value of sales in that subgroup.
definition: A resource controlled by an entity as a result of past events; and from which future economic benefits are expected to flow to the entity.
definition: Assets including debtors, cash, other financial shares and closing values of inventories, likely to be converted to cash, or consumed within a year.

definition: A liability is a present obligation of the entity arising from past events, the settlement of which is expected to result in an outflow from the entity of resources embodying economic benefits.
definition: Distributions of profits to holders of equity investments in propotion to their holdings of a particular class of capital.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: private sector statistics / category: Private Sector
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A legal unit or a combination of legal units that includes and directly controls all functions necessary to carry out its activities.

definition: Assets other than current assets, such as land, buildings, machinery and equipment. Typically, fixed assets are valued at the market price at the end of the financial year. See current assets, intangible assets, and non-current assets.

nso: Dithoto ta go se kgwathwe/ kgomiwe
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Identifiable non-monetary asset without physical substance.
definition: See fixed assets, and intangible assets.

definition: Stocks and work in progress, including: Outputs that are still held by the enterprise that produced them prior to their being further processed, sold, delivered to other units or used in other ways; Products acquired from other enterprises that are intended to be used for intermediate consumption or for resale without further processing (factored goods); Goods in the process of manufacturing or work that has been partially done, but which has not yet been completed at the end of the reference period; Other: Raw materials components for processing, packing materials, fuel, consumable and maintenance stores, own manufactures and factored goods that have not been sold at the end of the reference period.
definition: The difference between total income and total expenditure before providing for drawings by proprietors or partners, company or dividends.

eng: Net profit or loss after tax
afr: Netto wins of verlies n belasting
nbl: Inzuzo eseleko namkha ilahleko ngemva komthelo
nso: Maaledi a poelo goba tobo ka morago ga mothelo
sot: Phaello ya sebele kapa tahlehelo ka mora lekgetho
tsn: Poelotota kgotsa tatlhegelotota morago ga lekgetho
ssw: Insalelasamba yenzuzo nobe yekulahlekelwa emuva kwentsela
tso: Mbhidzuloxiheri kumbe ndzahlekelo endzhaku ka xibalo
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Net profit or loss less company tax paid or provided for during the reference period.

definition: Tangible items purchased by an entity primarily with the intention of selling them to customers. Note: Purchases include: Raw materials, components used in production; Fuels for off-road vehicles; Spare parts and building materials; Purchases and transfers-in of factored goods, intermediate products and partially completed goods from related enterprises.
definition: Payroll tax paid by registered levy payers on the total remuneration of their employees, in terms of the Local Government Transition Act (LGTA) of 1993.

definition: Services undertaken to protect an entitys assets. Note: Security services includes: Fees paid to contracted security companies; Electronic security systems such as alarms and surveillance cameras; IT security systems.

eng: Tax and company tax brought into account
afr: Belasting en maatskappybelasting in berekening geneem
nso: Mothelo le mothelo wa khamphane wa go tliwa ka gare ga akhaonte
sot: Lekgetho le lekgetho la khamphani le etsweng hloko
tsn: Lekgetho le lekgetho la ditlamo le le tsentsweng mo tshupatlotlong
ven: Lutho/muthelo na lutho/muthelo wa tshiimiswa /khamphani nga vhuifhinduleli
tso: Xibalo na xibalo xa khamphani leswi nghenisiweke eka nkota
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Taxes on incomes, profits and capital gains, excluding value added tax (VAT). They are assessed on the actual or presumed incomes of enterprises or other units and exclude the employees taxes and compulsory loan levies.

definition: The total value of sales in a business during the reference period, including: The value of sales; Amounts received for work done; amounts received for services rendered; rent and lease payments received for land and buildings, and other equipment; and excluding value-added tax (VAT); net profit or loss on sales or reevaluation of fixed assets (including profit or loss or foreign exchange); export freight charges; interest received; and excise duty.

eng: Book value of property, plant and equipment and intangible assets
afr: Boekwaarde van eiendom, aanleg en toerusting, en ontasbare bates
xho: ixabiso lepropati ngokwencwadi yoqingqo-maxabiso, iplanti, nezinto zexabiso ezingaphathekiyo
nso: Boleng bja bjale bja thoto, polante, didiriwa le dithoto ta go se swarege

eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: In order to finance the provision of infrastructure and other items of property, plant and equipment from internal sources, amounts are transferred from the accumulated surplus / deficit to the CRR in terms of a council resolution. The cash in the designated CRR bank account can only be utilised to finance items of property, plant and equipment. The CRR is reduced and the accumulated surplus / deficit is credited by a corresponding amount when the amounts in the CRR are utilised. The amount transferred to the CRR is based on the municipalitys need to finance future capital projects included in the Integrated Development Plan.

definition: The aggregate financial position of an institution at a specific point in time, usually at the end of the reporting period.

Note: The amounts in the column for depreciation represent amounts written off on assets by extra-budgetary accounts and funds and universities and technikons. The accounts of national and provincial governments are kept on a cash basis. No provision is made for depreciation in the accounts of municipalities.
definition: A member of the municipal council as determined by the Local Government Municipal Structures Act (Act No. 117 of 1998).

ven: Tshelede yo shumiswaho uno waha / Mbadelo dza uno waha

 Interest paid

 Grants

Exclusions:
 Consumption of fixed capital. (excluding the surplus and non-cash expenditure items)
 Total expenditure on housing and trading services (excluding the surplus and non-cash expenditure items)
definition: Part of the profit of a company that is paid to its shareholders. It includes cash dividends and other dividends such as capitalisation issues or scrip dividends or capitalisation shares.
definition: Finance, corporate services, human resources, information technology, property services, and other administration.

ven: Thundu kana ndaka ya gwama / Thundu kana ndaka ya tshelede

eng_pos_or_descriptor_info:
definition: Unit primarily engaged in both incurring liabilities and acquiring financial assets in the market.
Note: Financial institutions may be entirely or mainly owned and / or controlled by government in which case they are regarded as public financial institutions. It is the prime function of financial institutions to act as intermediaries.

tsn: Tshalelothusotlole ya puso / Tshalelokabelotlole ya puso
ven: Mbetshelo ya gavhelo ya muvhuso / Mbetshelo ya mphomali ya muvhuso
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: When items of property, plant and equipment are financed from government grants, a transfer is made from the accumulated surplus / deficit to the Government Grants Reserve equal to the Government Grant recorded as revenue in the Statement of Financial Performance in accordance with a directive (budget circular) issued by National Treasury. When such items of property, plant and equipment are depreciated, a transfer is made from the Government Grant Reserve to the accumulated surplus / deficit. The purpose of this policy is to promote community equity by ensuring that the future depreciation expenses that will be incurred over the useful lives of government grant funded items of property, plant and equipment are offset by transfers from this reserve to the accumulated surplus / deficit. When an item of property, plant and equipment financed from government grants is disposed, the balance in the Government Grant Reserve relating to such item is transferred to the accumulated surplus / deficit.

sot: Dineelo / Dinehelo / Ditsiane / Krante tse lefilweng
ven: Magavhelo o badelwaho / Mphomali dzo badelwaho

eng_pos_or_descriptor_info:
definition: Fund into which all proceeds from housing developments, which include rental income and sales of houses, are paid, as per the Housing Act (Act No. 107 of 1997).
Note:
 Loans from national and provincial government used to finance housing selling schemes undertaken by the municipality were extinguished on 1 April 1998 and transferred to a housing development fund.
 Housing selling schemes both complete and in progress as at 1 April 1998, were also transferred to the housing development fund.
 Monies outstanding to the credit of the housing development fund can be used only to finance housing developments within the municipal area subject to the approval of the Provincial MEC responsible for housing.

definition: Housing services include approved housing projects and can be subdivided in respect of various economic, subeconomic, complexes or other types of housing. Where dwellings form part of the general organisation of a particular department, and are normally occupied by employees of the department, they are included in the relative statement and not under housing services. Likewise, where properties are purchased for a specific purpose, such as a street widening, and existing houses are demolished; the annual expenditure and income in respect of these dwellings do not appear in the housing service. See individual services.
definition: Identifiable non-monetary asset without physical substance.
definition: The price paid for the use of borrowed money, or money earned by deposited funds.

definition: A household that qualifies to receive some or all basic services for free because they have no income or low income.

definition: A communal place of residence for people with common characteristics.

Examples: hospital, school hostel, prison, defence force barracks or convent. Such sets of living quarters usually have certain common facilities shared by the occupants, i.e. baths, lounges, dormitories, etc.
definition: Two or more households living in one dwelling unit.

definition: A steady income received by a person, usually after retirement, from a former employer, pension fund or other retirement provider.

definition: Land that is usually used for entertainment purposes.

definition: Transfers in cash or in kind to protect the entire population or a specific segment of it against certain social risks.

definition: An effect which deprives a statistical result of representativeness by systematically distorting it, as distinct from a random error which may distort on any one occasion but balances out on the average.

definition: The total process of collecting, processing, analyzing and publishing or otherwise disseminating demographic, economic and social data pertaining to all persons in a country or in a well-defined part of a country at a specified time. See population census.
definition: A set of discrete, exhaustive and mutually exclusive categories that can be assigned to one or more variables or items.

sot: Tlhophiso ya ka bomong ya sepheo sa tshebediso

tso: Ntlawahato wa mutirhisi ku ya hi xikongomelo
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: International system of classification of goods and services based on individual consumption by purpose.

definition: Classification that follows prescribed rules and is generally recommended and accepted.
Note: Standard classifications aim to ensure that information is classified consistently regardless of the collection, source, point of time, etc.

xho: inkqubo yocalulo, indlela yokwahlula ngokweemfano-mpawu/ngokokufana kweempawu

xho: ucalulo lweenkcukacha, indlela yokwahlula uluhlu ngokulandelelana
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: List of mutually exclusive categories representing the version-specific values of the classification variable.
definition: Sampling method where the elements are drawn in groups often based on proximity. This overcomes the constraints of costs and time associated with a much-dispersed population.
definition: A language-independent set of letters, numbers or symbols that represent a concept whose meaning is described in a natural language.

ven: Mutevhe wa dzikhoudu / Mutevhe wa khoudu

definition: The process of converting verbal or textual information into codes representing classes within a classification scheme, to facilitate data processing, storage or dissemination.
definition: The assignment of an incorrect code to a data item.
definition: Adequacy of statistics to be combined in different ways and for various uses.

nso: Mokgwatlaleleto wa tshedimoo ka tshedimoo ya pele/kholoteke
tso: Ngheniso wa switiviwa/datara / hi vutivi bya khale

definition: See data collection.
definition: The extent to which differences between statistics can be attributed to differences between the true values of the statistical characteristics.
definition: See relevance.

definition: A process of rectifying characters manually according to predefined rules. It is done on unrecognised data received from the tiling process.
Note: Completion is carried out on all alpha characters and numeric characters to improve coding accuracy.
definition: A unit of knowledge created by a unique combination of characteristics.
definition: Concept that expresses its valid instance meanings or description.
definition: A property of data indicating the extent to which their unauthorised disclosure could be prejudicial or harmful to the interest of the source or other relevant parties.
definition: Logical and numerical coherence.

xho: ukudibanisa ngenjongo yokwenza iinkcukacha ezibuya kwiindawo-ngeendawo zihambiselane
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The process that takes data from different systems, entities (and possibly formats) and combines that information to create a unified view.

ven: Khwahisedzo hafhu ya zwi re nga ngomu

definition: Circumstance, purpose, and perspective under which an object is defined or used.
definition: The definition of the population that statistics aim to cover.

definition: A representation of facts, concepts, or instructions in a formal manner, suitable for communication, interpretation, or processing by humans or by automatic means.

tsn: Bophiri ba dinewa, bophiri ba dintlha
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A property of data, usually resulting from legislative measures, which prevents it from unauthorised disclosure.

definition: A unit of data for which the definition, identification, representation and permissible values are specified by a set of attributes.
definition: One occurrence of a data element.

ven: U shuma data / U hahuvha data

definition: Exchange of data and / or metadata in a situation involving the use of open, freely available data formats and where process patterns are known and standard.
definition: A statement of the precise meaning of something within the context of intended use.
definition: A record with discrete entries arranged by date reporting on what has happened over the course of a defined period of time (e.g. diary of expenditure, diary of time use, etc.)
definition: Distribution or transmission of statistical data to users.

eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: See hot deck.

definition: A further attempt to obtain information because the initial attempt has failed or new information has become available.
definition: A list, map or other specification of the units which define a population to be completely enumerated or sampled.

tso: Ngheniso wa switiviwa/datara ku ya hi vutivi byintshwa

definition: The procedure of entering a value for a specific data item, where the response is missing or unusable.
definition: Knowledge concerning any objects such as facts, events, things, processes or ideas including concepts that within a certain context have particular meanings.
definition: The data collection process by which the fieldworker puts the questions on the questionnaire to the respondent and records the answers. See self-enumeration.

ssw: Silinganiso sebantfu labaphendvule imibuto kuleso lebesilindzelwe
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: The ratio of the number of eligible units responding to an item to the number of responding units eligible to have responded to the item.

tso: Ku nghenisa mahungu hi ku languta xifaniso

tso: Ku nghenisa mahungu hi ku languta eka phepha
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A process of capturing data by looking at the physical questionnaire.
definition: An error committed during listing.
definition: See cold deck.
definition: Observation data gained by a purposeful aggregation of statistical micro data.

ven: Tshigwada tshihulwane tshine vhavhudziswa vha do nangwa khatsho
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A sample drawn from a population for use on a number of future occasions, so as to avoid ad hoc sampling on each occasion.
definition: Data about data, that refers to the definitions, descriptions of procedures, system parameters, and operational results which characterise and summarise statistical programs.
definition: An information system for registering metadata.
definition: A set of research methods and techniques applied to a particular field of study.
definition: Observation data collected on an individual object or statistical unit.
definition: Sampling method where selection of the sample is carried out in several stages, i.e. primary units are regarded as a population from which subsamples of secondary units are selected.

nso: Dipalopalo ta bosethaba ta go se be ta semmuo
ven: Mbalombalo/ zwitatistika zwi si zwa tshiofisi mbalombalo / zwitatisitiki zwa lushaka zwi si zwa tshiofisi

nso: Tshedimoo ye e ka se diriwego / Tshedimoo ye e ka se diriegego

definition: Statistics that meet the quality requirements as stipulated by Stats SA and are relevant beyond the organ or agency that collected them.
definition: A questionnaire that has not been fully completed.

nso: Tshedimookakareto ya dintlhakgoboketwa ta go bobama

definition: Geographical area comprising one or more enumeration areas of the same type (and therefore not necessarily contiguous) that together have at least one hundred dwelling units.
definition: The technique that is used to obtain a complete and relevant response by asking further questions.
definition: A person who answers questions on behalf of another person.

ven: Bugu ya u tevhekanya/khethekanya zwiimiswa ya PSU

definition: It is a unique number given to a primary sampling unit (PSU) for the purpose of record-keeping.
definition: A type of public relations in the form of a news item or story which conveys information about a product, service, or idea in the media.
definition: All actions taken to ensure that standards and procedures are adhered to and that delivered products or services meet performance requirements.
definition: Systems and frameworks in place within an organisation to manage the quality of statistical products and processes.
definition: A request for information.

definition: Statistics which meet almost none of the quality requirements as stipulated by Stats SA. They are designated as questionable statistics to the extent that no deductions can be made, and they are therefore unusable.
definition: A group or sequence of questions designed to elicit information upon a subject, or a sequence of subjects, from an informant.
definition: The process of developing a questionnaire.
definition: The amount of something considered in relation to, or measured according to another amount multiplied by a constant, usually 100 or 1 000 or 100 000, e.g. birth rate.

definition: The estimate that indicates percentage change in the variables of interest over two different periods of time. It shows the growth or decline in such variables. For instance Gross Domestic Product (GDP) growth rates, rate of inflation, population growth rates, etc.

definition: A unique number usually from 001600 pre-printed in the Enumerator Area Summary Book.
Note: During listing, each dwelling unit or other place to be visited for purposes of enumeration is associated with a separate record number in the EA Summary Book. Each record number is on a separate line or row.
definition: The period of time (day, week, month, or year) for which information is relevant.
definition: Situation when a household or individual refuses to answer the questions or complete the questionnaire.

definition: The person or organisation that answers the questions or completes the questionnaire.
definition: Part of the population on which information can be obtained to infer about the whole population of units of interest.
definition: A survey conducted using a sample.
definition: Selecting elements from a population in such a way that they are representative of the population.
definition: That part of the difference between a population value and an estimate derived from a random sample which is due to the fact that only a sample was observed. See non-sampling error.

eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: See cluster sampling, multi-stage sampling, simple random sampling, stratified sampling, and systematic sampling.

definition: A segment of the population for which separate statistics are needed.

The sample is selected by taking the nth, (n+s) th, (n+2s) th, ,,.. etc., where n is not larger than the sampling interval (s), which is obtained by dividing the total population by the sample size.

ven: Tshitshavha tsho tiwaho / Tshitshavha tsho topolwaho / Tshitshavha tsho mvaiwaho

definition: A designation of a defined concept in a special language by a linguistic expression.

definition: The importance of an object in relation to a set of objects to which it belongs.

definition: An enterprise unit, the principal activity of which is to provide temporary stay to a guest who in return pays an amount of fee charged. Inclusions: hotels, motels, inns, caravan parks and camping sites, guest houses, guest farms, bed-and-breakfast enterprises, all kinds of lodges, accommodation in natural surroundings, game lodges/nature reserves offering mostly accommodation (exclude if part of game reserve, also earning income for preservation/ conservation purposes), furnished holiday flats and chalets, holiday resorts, student residences, hostels, boarding houses, backpacker or school dormitories and other accommodation not elsewhere classified.
definition: An enterprise unit that is operational in the open market and that has paid value added tax and/or income tax to the South African Revenue Service at least once.
definition: A process involving a combination of actions that result in a certain set of products and services.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: System of Registers / category: System of Business Registers
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info:
definition: An activity that supports the main productive activity of an enterprise by providing non-durable goods or services, entirely or primarily for the use of the enterprise.

definition: A company with more than 25% but less than 50% of its issued share capital owned by another company.
definition: A calendar date on which a business last paid value added tax and/or income tax.
definition: An event where a legal unit is divided into two or more separate legal units and the original legal unit ceases to exist.

definition: Part of an enterprise that is situated at a remote location from the main enterprise and in which productive activity is carried out.

nso: Lekala la kgwebokgolo ya go twa ntle /lekala la kgwebokgolo e ele

eng: Club, welfare organisation, association not for gain

ven: Binduhanganelwa a koniraka / o sainelwaho mbofho

definition: The definition of the population that statistics aim to cover.
definition: Life status of a statistical unit which has been confirmed dormant, temporarily stopped trading or is under sequestration.
definition: The process of dividing an enterprise into sub-units suitable for statistics.

tso: Xivangelo xa ncinco wa xiyimo ya yuniti ya tinhlayohlayo

definition: A place of storage in a remote location from the main enterprise.
definition: See deactivated enterprise.

ven: Mbambadzo / vhushavhi / makwevho / vhuvhambadzi ha tshielektroniki / ikhomese

nbl: Iinkoro ezikulu zomnotho; imikhakha emikhulu yezomnotho

definition: Economic production is an activity carried out under the control and responsibility of an institutional unit that uses inputs of labour, capital, and goods and services to produce outputs of goods or services.
definition: The extent to which a companys activity contributes to the economy and, in particular, to the industrial sector to which it belongs.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: System of Registers / category: System of Business Registers
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A person (permanently, temporarily or casually employed) who normally works the agreed hours in his /her present job.

definition: Those surveys in which enterprises (or producing units belonging to these enterprises) constitute the observation units about which data are obtained, the sampled units comprising the survey frame and the reporting units from which data are obtained.
definition: A turnover that has manually been updated to enterprise unit by either the investigation or profiling and delineation personnel.

definition: A legal unit or the smallest combination of legal units that includes and directly controls all the functions necessary to carry out its production activities and provide services.
Note: It is an economic entity that is capable, in its own right, to own assets, incur liabilities, engage in economic activities and in transactions with other entities, and to be involved in litigation. They take decisions and actions for which they are held responsible and accountable for by law, and they compile complete sets of accounts (including profit-and-loss accounts and balance sheets).

eng_pos_or_descriptor: System of Registers / category: System of Business Registers
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: An enterprise, or part of an enterprise, which is situated at a single location in which only a single productive activity is carried out or in which the principal productive activity accounts for most of the value added.

eng_pos_or_descriptor: System of Registers / category: System of Business Registers
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A statistical unit on which farming operations are carried out for commercial purposes by any person, company, close corporation or other enterprise, for his/her or its own account.
definition: Any accounting period of twelve months.
definition: A diagram that shows the flow of activities within a process.
definition: A measurement of the frame size that is determined by aggregating measurements of the statistical units in the frame.
definition: An activity carried out under the control and responsibility of an institutional unit that uses inputs of labour, capital goods and services to produce outputs of goods and services.

definition: A statistical unit or part of a statistical unit involved in one, or predominantly one, kind of activity from one location, on a permanent basis, having at least one person employed and of which the main activity can be classified on a 5-digit SIC code.
definition: See geographic unit.

definition: Institutional units that engage in activities of a purely governmental nature. Inclusions: National government; Provincial government; Local government; Extra budgetary accounts and funds; and Tertiary institutions.

tsn: Dituelo/megolo le ditefo pele ga ditloso
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Payments for ordinary-time, standard or agreed hours and over-time hours during the reference period for all permanent, temporary, casual, executive and managerial employers/employees before taxation and other deductions. Inclusions: Payments in kind to farming employees such as meals, rations and free housing, but excluding rations and bonuses to farming contractors and their employees.

tsn: Kgwebokgolo e e okameng tse dingwe

definition: A unit of area equal to 10 000 square metres, commonly used for measuring land area.

sot: Melao ya nalane ya tlhophiso ya diindasteri

tso: Milawu ya matimu ya ntlawahato wa vumaki

Example: Integrated activities like the farming with grapes together with the manufacturing of wine on the farm by the same unit, having no separate records or accounts available, will apply and these will be classified under wine farming.

ven: hanganyo tshayambofhano ya vhuitwa / mishumo ya Ekonomi
tso: Nhlanganiso wo nava wa migingiriko ya xiikhonomi

Example: The manufacturing of bakery products combined with the manufacturing of chocolate confectionery. The unit should be classified to the SIC class or subgroup with the largest share of value added, as determined, by using the top-down method.

sot: Nyalanyo ya yuniti ya kgwebokgolo ka tshebedisano

tso: Nhlanganiso wo nava wa yuniti ya bindzunyingi
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: A combination of two or more businesses within the same group company structure operating together on the market as one unit.

nso: Dikgwebokgolo ta lapa te di sa hlakanywago
sot: Dikgwebokgolo tse sa kopanang tsa lelapa

nso: Dikgebokgolo ta lapa tsa mmaraka wo o sa hlakanywago
sot: Dikgwebokgolo tsa mmaraka tse sa kopanang tsa lelapa
ven: Mabindu a bveledziselaho mbambadzo / makete / maraga
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: Enterprise units that produce goods or services for sale or barter on the market.

nso: Khamphani ye e laolago dikgwebo te dingwe
tsn: Kgwebo e e okameng tse dingwe; mmadikgwebo
eng_pos_or_descriptor_info: definition: See holding company.

eng_pos_or_descriptor_info:
definition: Comprises all tourism consumption expenditure that takes place within the given country.
Note: It includes all domestic tourism consumption, inbound tourism consumption, and the part of outbound tourism consumption which corresponds to goods and services provided by residents. It might include goods and services imported into the economy and domestically sold to visitors. It differs from internal tourism consumption by the part of outbound tourism consumption which corresponds to goods and services provided by residents.

definition: A journey undertaken by one or more members of the household for at least one night away from home, where a person did not receive any remuneration (did not make any profit) at that destination. It is important to note that a trip must be complete. That means a trip is only applicable when a person returns to his/her place of residence.

definition: To be outside the usual environment' the person should travel more than 40 kilometres from his/her place of residence (one way) AND the place should NOT be visited more than once a week. This includes place of work and place of study. Leisure and recreational trips are included irrespective of frequency.
